text: Wanted something different and my lady found this new little gem. The Chef helped opened Momofuku and you can definitely see that on the menu. A lot of Asian inspired dishes with a few new Americana options , like the pretzels and beer cheese with sea salt. Only been opened a couple weeks. I liked it and we will definitely be coming back.

This place has the worst service I've ever experienced. My boyfriend and I walked in and there were no employees anywhere. There were some people seated at the bar with food and drinks already, but no bartender, host, or waiter in sight. We stood around for a few minutes wondering if it was self seating or not. We wanted to sit at the booths but there was a large partition and we didn't want to be overlooked so we decided to sit at the bar, seeing as how there were no waiters to be found. Through the small window in the door we could see "employees" in the back walking around. It appeared that one was either eating or drinking something in the back. 5 minutes pass by.... what seemed like 10 minutes passed by until someone finally walked out. At this point we were about to walk out. No apology. He tended to the customers that were already there first. Finally he came over and handed us menus. He clearly had no service industry experience. We basically had to flag him down to order drinks and food. It took about 5 minutes in between each order because he kept walking away and talking to other people and wouldn't check in on us. We basically had to interrupt him to order things. And when we did he just gave us a blank look and said OK or YEAH. We ordered the loco moco poutine with has option of spam or hamburger and he didn't even bother to ask which we wanted. We had to tell him to make sure he knew. We had to order our Bahn mi through the other bar tender, who was a smidge more personable. Our food came and it smelled and looked amazing. But once we took a bite of the poutine... it wasn't very good. Gravy was too thick and bland. The Bahn mi sandwich was decent. The pork belly was cooked well but all I tasted was raw jalape√±o. We finished our drinks and No one asked if we wanted a refill. We asked for the check and waited forever because the guy was talking to other patrons. We had to ask again because we thought he forgot. Then I think he realized we were upset and then started being friendly. A little too late. He made small talk about my tattoo and informed me that he was a tattoo artist. Not sure why is was working the bar. Overall... this wouldn't such a bad place if the service was even decent but the customer service is non existent and the bar was dirty, it had a bunch of dried beer on it and had not been wiped. Not sure if I came on an off day or what, but I really don't understand how it has such  good reviews.

I've been here a few times and each time has been excellent. The staff was super friendly and even remembered my name when I came back. The drink selection is great (Cali Creamin on Nitro FTW!) and the food is great. The burrata and heirloom tomato salad is by far the best I've ever had. The chili is also really good. I love the interior and the stack of games are a nice touch. I'll definitely be coming here regularly.

We eat out a lot and always looking for new places. This came up as a recommendation thru yelp. Small space but feels like a true locals spot. My wife and I throughly enjoyed the fried deviled eggs and the signature banh mi.  Looked like they had a good rotation on tap. Awesome sauce served with the fries too!!

Was looking for a casual lunch spot on our drive back from Zion to California. This was one of the few places open before noon that wasn't located in the congested downtown strip area. We were glad that we drove off the freeway to eat here. Very cool spot with good service all around. 
My wife and I shared the spring rolls to start. I had the traditional poutine, which was a great portion size and had excellent flavors. My wife had the baby green salad, which was also a large serving size with great fresh ingredients. The manager was very personable and eager to answer any of our questions. Will definitely return here the next time we are in Vegas.
Awesome food and great atmosphere!!!! Check this place out when you're in Vegas and wants something out of the strip! Great job!
Amazing tuna burger!  And an outstanding selection of craft beers.  Including 4 right now from Black Market Brewery.  So many other good choices.  MNF and happy hour.  Perfect.

The food here is delicious and the restaurant is small and cozy! I really enjoyed this bar with their craft beers and unique cocktails. The food had a great spice, and the bread pudding was TO DIE FOR. I am one who avoids desert and eats healthy but every bite of that Nutella bread pudding was worth the calories.

Great local spot. Fantastic beer and cocktail selection, our server recommended a Trinidad Sour, great choice. We ordered the crispy deviled eggs, wings, banh mi sandwich and the vermicelli salad, everything was delicious, especially the eggs. I'll be back to try the rest of the menu which has a little Asian flair to it.

Great setting, casual and comfortable space, hidden in a small strip-mall.

Smaller on the inside than it looks from the outside, definitely a good place to go with a group of friends.

We ordered the wings. Those are a must! I almost never clean to the bones... these were good enough to. Crispy wings, moist meat, incredible sauce.

We also both ordered pub burgers, cooked medium. I added a farm fresh egg - they broke the egg, probably while building, bummer. He got his with bacon. This made them $15 burgers. Were they? Not really. Probably would've paid $12 total. They were cooked great, good size; a little fatty. Probably a 70/30 ground beef.

Last note: they have games there including cards against humanity, in case you don't want to watch sports on one of their three screens.

First time here and I was not disappointed. Great and fast service. I had  the craft burger and fries. Very tasty! Side note share the fries, pretty big order, enough for two.

They have a big selection of draft beers on tap too.

Tasted the signature banh mi sandwich and I'm pretty sure, it's the best banh mi I've had!  

Professional and friendly staff and clean establishment!

My boyfriend and I went to 595 for date night over the weekend on Friday night. It was a little confusing whether or not to seat ourselves, but we did and it took a solid 15 minutes before our server approached us. Once we got our menus it took us a while to decide what to get and ordered and assortment of things. My boyfriend got a cocktail that was called the "queen bee" I believe, and it was fantastic. I highly recommend it. The fried deviled eggs were pretty good, but I've had better before. The pork belly Banh mi was very good and very spicy. We also got a burrata chutney that was good, but where we sat by the window it got cold quickly. So we ate about half of it, then it then it wasn't very melty anymore. Over all the food is good, cocktails were amazing, and service was a little slow but a good experience over all and would come back on a weekday.

A friend suggested meet for lunch and mentioned 595 Craft and Kitchen. After checking out the excellent yelp reviews and noticing they have a nice selection of craft beers on tap, we agreed to meet her there. Located in a strip mall, lots of parking, seating at the bar, tables or high tops. Our server, Tristan, was very friendly and knowledgeable, explaining that all the food dishes were prepared fresh only after the customer orders since everything the kitchen prepares is ordered daily. We ordered two Pork Belly Bahn Mi sandwiches, a Chicken Bahn Mi and Veggie Spring Rolls-everything was flavorful, fresh and very tasty! I asked Tristan for some beer suggestions and she sold me on the Occidental Dunkel, which was very nice with lunch-smooth and perfect with my Pork Belly Bahn Mi! They also had Coca-Cola products which is a definite plus with my wife, who must have a Coke with her meals! Looking forward to going again and checking out more of their food and beers!

Came to Vegas on a quick weekend trip and ate at 595 Craft and Kitchen base off the reviews.  This place does not disappoint because the food was AMAZING and service was Outstanding!  My favorite was the deep fried devil eggs and deep fried chicken skins.  The craft beers were also great.  Can't wait to head back and visit this place again!

Super awesome find on yelp away from the tourists and hanging with the locals.  The burrata salad was amazing with pork!  They have an awesome craft beer selection from San Diego. Owner is from there and these are legit, small micro breweries!!!

This place was amazing!  We stopped in for happy hour after a round of golf at Spanish Trail and couldn't have been more pleased with this find!  We had a beer from the diverse selection of microbrews, and a few happy hour appetizers.....Bahn mi sliders and fried chicken skin!  Both were great!  We also ordered the Loco Moco poutine which was over the top good!! Way to much food but we just ate the poutine and took the rest to go!  Service was also great!!

Amazing ambiance and delicious food. The mood is perfect for locals or for out of town guests in the know. This place has flavors you won't find in many places and they're willing to take risks in both their food and their beer selection which includes some hard to find or impossible to find brews. Definitely recommend for anyone looking to get off the strip, reset, and enjoy a real dinner with unexpected flavors.

Best fried chicken sandwich in the city
Good beer selection 
Chill atmosphere 
Devil eggs rock too

Amazing service!!!! Great beer selection and service with a smile! We're from out of town and got great advice from a very friendly bartender. Food was very good and fast. I would recommend this place to anyone!!! Ask for Bozo, he is awesome!

I gave this 3 stars because of the pricing and the portions. While I thought the food was good I would never have thought that I would pay $25 for this. The deep fried eggs were 4 pieces which amounted to 2 eggs total. All that came with it were some chopped up chives on the tray. This was $9. The tuna sandwich was tuna steak on a roll with some garlic aioli and some greens and this was $14. All sides were extra. Are you kidding me?

First time checking out this spot and we will definitely come back again! Fried devil egg was amazing! This bar actually had a lot of beers that the local bars do not carry. Finally an intimate craft beer/food place that's not over crowded or some chain restaurant. The manager Van was super nice along with his two bartenders. They suggested awesome drinks and they greeted & said goodbye to every customer that walked in/out! You don't get that kind of service anymore! Can't wait till the weather cools off to sit outside and have a drink!

I am elated to have discovered a beer Pub with a myriad of craft & unique seasonal beers. I love the casual yet sexy setting, which reminds me of a boutique hotel w/ stylish interior designs. 

The unique menu offers comfort food selections, balanced by fresh ingredients, topped with gourmet & delicate flavors. Some of the foods have popular Vietnamese themes, such as cold spring rolls and Banh Mi sandwiches. And there are a ton of delicious American food selections as well. 

I like the variety of music selections and/or genres at 595. I also appreciate multiple flat-screen TV's at the pub for people that enjoy watching sports. 

Last, but certainly not the least, I like the reasonable pricing of their beer & food items. It is immensely refreshing to have a cool local hangout, instead of walking through smokey, pricey, & noisy casinos.
Went here for lunch and the food is good. The banh mi sandwiches were pretty tasty and the deep fried deviled eggs were buttery soft. Can't wait to try out more of the menu items!

This place really surprised me. It's in a strip mall next to a Walgreens and a Cheveron but it really is a gem! When you walk in, it kind of has a California vibe the bar has a few chalk boards with all the beers on tab. My boyfriend ordered the "New IPA who dis" by Joseph James he said it was good. 

We shared the FRIED DEVILED EGGS
5/5 on those. They are beer battered and fried to perfection! The spicy aioli it comes with is delicious too!

We also shared the PORK BELLY BUHN MI
5/5 sooo good! The pork belly is seasoned so well and melts in your mouth and the fresh veggies in the bun are crispy. 

I ordered the Gordon Gin, it was very well mixed. Not too heavy on the lemon and a good taste of gin and mint. I'd come back for this cocktail alone. 

We were not really impressed!

This place is a good fusion pub. We started the night off with Crispy Chicken Skins with a side of sweet chili sauce. The chicken skins were warm and freshly fried and lightly seasoned with salt, green onions, and a dusting of chili powder. The chicken skins were slightly spicy, giving it a good kick and unique flavor from regular chicken skin. For the main course, I had the Pork Belly Bahn Mi. The pork belly was cooked to perfection, with the fat rendered and the meat being very tender. The pickled cucumber and carrots accentuated the flavors of the pork and were not too sour. 
This is a great place to catch up with friends and grab a quick bite to eat.

My favorite local craft kitchen and bar! The owner is extremely kind and definitely knows his beer. This is definitely a must go for anyone who loves beer, good food and great vibes. 

The loco moco poutine fries are definitely a must try. The portion is size is more than plenty to share. What really had me going in for the next bite was the gravy!

 I have too many good things to rave about their bread pudding! Great contrast of warm straight out the oven luscious bread pudding and cold whipped cream. 

It's always a pleasure dining here!

Food was good, beer menu was excellent but we had a serious problem with the bartender... Bad attitude, inattentive service and basically on ignore the whole time. 

I liked everything else about it but in a town with so many great options I won't go back.

Recommended while I was in town by an old friend. Wasn't disappointed in the least. Friendly staff, small seating but quaint and intimate atmosphere. The hangover fries and burger were literally perfect. Would recommend to anyone in the area for locals and for those visiting off the strip. Will come back again and again!!

Found this place on yelp, looked like the perfect spot to hang out and get some grub after a concert.  The food menu looked great and had some great beers from our home town San Diego.  It turned out to be a great night, good/fun music, great service, delicious food and good selection of drinks.  There were 8 of us in the party and we each ordered something different, but everyone was happy.   Will come back for sure, next time we are in town.

My wife and I decided to try a new place to get a burger near our home. Our server was very nice and attentive. We both ordered our burgers medium well however they came medium rare. My wife's french fries were cold and my poutine fries had a gravy that was sweet tasting. Once was enough for us we won't be back.
Great beers and food.  Try the deep fried deviled eggs.  Everyone at our table raved about the food and beer.  Will go back again.

Really cool place! Awesome music. Cool crowd with cooler employees. Not sure of any other bar in the area that does cocktails quite like 595. The Mezcal Cup is my favorite. The food is amazing. Their menu has a Asian twist. Try the Banh Mi sandwich--You're welcome! Great place to go watch your favorite sports game. The staff really cares and always goes above and beyond to give you an enjoyable experience. Bring your friends!

We actually live down the st and passed by this place during renovation when we went to Meraki (which is a must try!!)

The dynamic was chill, extended beer menu and our waitress,Chelsea, did an excellent job with her recommendation! We loved everything! The chicken skin, the beercheese dip, the Banh Mi and the heirloom tomato salad!! 

We definitely be back like we promised! :)

A must try new restaurant/bar! Very friendly staff and fast service. We ordered 2 items:

Signature Banh Mi Sandwich: this was one of the best I've tried. Very flavorful, fresh and they were very generous with the marinated pork! This was yummy! A must try.

The Craft Burger with bacon: the bun was just the right texture! Meat cooked to a medium perfection with just the right toppings! 

We ordered 2 orders of the fries, I would recommend ordering one to share. It was big enough for two people. That would be my only suggestion, the server should have informed us of the portion size. 

They have a full bar with a variety of craft beers on tap, I'm not a drinker but I'm sure it would be a beer lovers paradise!

I first noticed this place when they were under construction when I stopped in to eat at Meraki next door(definitely recommend if you want Greek food.) Then I started following their remodel updates. Van and the staff really create a great atmosphere if you want a bar that's actually a bar. I will be going here regularly.
It was a really good happy hour. I wanted to try more but a good slider and chicken skins. Great menu for beer.

Probably one of the top five best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. The food here is delicious. Prices are solid too. Beer selection is excellent and they have a few unique cocktails for $11. Good stuff all around. It's small, but it's how they use it that counts. Definitely going back here more. 
Oh yeah, no gambling and no smoking. Dig it.

Happened by this place by chance, and I was happy that I did. Solid craft beer list. Bahn Mi with pork belly was very good, though I admittedly haven't had many of this type of sandwich. My friend ordered the hot fried chicken sandwich and was very pleased with it - it was actually hot (spicy). Fries were well above average.

I'm not a big atmosphere place but.....
But.....


I really like it here.  

I feel like I'm in my living room having a beer with friends and the culinary dudes/dudettes are getting tipsy in the kitchen sending out their favorite comfort food to the lazy ones of us that just want to chill on the sofa. 

Nice chill beat coming from the speakers. 
Quiet tv's with sports 
Nothing but craft beers on tap. 

Server : Tristian

Exceedingly warm and friendly. 
She's like the only chick you've ever dated that your friends will let you invite on camping trips. 

Chill, cool, warm, friendly , funny..,, she carried a perpetual infectious smile. 


I felt welcome here. 

And the food was fantastic. 

--

I've now been here 3 more times. 
Food and service continue to be fantastic. 
Great salads. 
Best double fried fries ever. 

Server Casey. Incredibly warm and friendly. 

Thanks 595 

---------------
Again and again and again. 
I think my naive and I who live in Alaska patronize 595 as much as a local. 

Can't stop coming here. 
Stopped by yet again. 
I thought I'd be good with a song order. 
Nope!
I had to order a second serving. 
So juicy , flavorful, easy to bite a chunk of chicken protein off a bone. 

Between the gourmet fries
The artistic salads , and the beer. 
I wish I lived next door. 
Well..... then I'd be drunk and stuffed all the time!

Hmmmm
Not a bad idea. 

Wanna get stuffed and buzzed. 

Come in!
------

Next day 4-12-18 
Stopped by AGAIN!
The VERY NEXT DAY!?

I must like this place!!!
--------------

4-16/18.  AGAIN!!!
Damn the fries here are fantastic. 
I've tried to make my own at home.
Water soaking 
Double frying, getting the best counter top Grier I can get...( no such thing)

595 soaks their potatoes for thee hours in cold water to draw the starches out, then fries them. 
Then......
Fries then a second time. 
Makes me want to spend 400$ on my own 220v fryer to use next to my outdoor grill..... 
hmmmm maybe not. 

It's a lot easier to get served these delicacies at 595 and get s beer to boot. ( faster too)

The wings are so juicy. 
I'm afraid to try to poutine, it's also made from scratch.  My bellies big enough.  I have enough addictions.  
The fries are one of them. 

Servers and ambiance are so warm. 
Thanks 595!
-----------/
AGAIN. 4th visit this week !
God the fries are orgasmic. 
Casey. Our favorite server. 
Smiley,warm,conversational when time allows. 
What a gem.
The food here is always good. The beer selection is varied and interesting, and the staff are second to none. I love this place!

Amazing decor. Great cocktails and amazing rotating craft beer selection. The Omnipollo IPA is to die for. Crab dynamite was legit and the banh mi's were fantastic. Charles our server and bartender was awesome. Good ish on you my dude!

Two Words: Beer Me

I love the vibes and decor here - industrial, modern design. I was greeted by the bartenders and you could tell that they were really proud to work there. I came here for lunch and it was also happy hour. 

I ordered the "bad ass" poutine which is spicy chili, smoked bacon, cheese, and beer on top of crispy fries. It is definitely spicy, but nothing I couldn't handle. 

The Vietnamese spring roll is a classic and I love how they made it. Fresh ingredients.

They have an array of beer, and they even let you test a few! I ordered quite a few, I cant remember which ones. So, I guess you'd have to stop in to try! I met Van, the owner, when he served me one of my beers. He is a great guy. Can't wait to go back again!
Phenomenal service, amazing drinks, delicious food all made in house from scratch! The ambience was wonderful!

It's ok.....We went here for dinner on a Friday and sat at the bar. It is small and cozy. The first bartender was awesome (purple hair). She greeted us right away and made us feel welcome. She helped us choose beers and we got our food....but then all of a sudden she was gone??? We were done eating and there were two other people there. We needed more water, beer, and the tab. We were ignored and not helped. My husband had to ask for more napkins, drinks, and wet naps after we sat there for 15-20 minutes with dirty dishes in front of us. Where did my other bar tender go? We wanted to thank you for your awesome service and leave you a good tip! Anyways the food was ok, nothing out the normal bar food. We ordered the pork spring rolls, home made fries, and chicken wings. The pumpkin patch beer was pretty good. Yard House at the Red Rock has better food though and beer so we picked up and went there. We will not be back here. Sorry.

Amazing place. I had a rough situation at first but I decided to give them another chance and everything was amazing. Van, the owner is an amazing person who really cares about everyone who comes through the doors. The server was incredible. Anyone who has the chance to come here and doesn't will thoroughly regret it.

I see that 595 Craft and Kitchen has a lot of potential! They have a great selection of beer, and drinks. Our bartender took the time to ask us what kind of drinks we liked, to better compliment our tastes. Incredibly friendly and easy to talk to. When you walk in, its open seating. You'll find that the atmosphere is friendly and cozy. Perfect place to catch up with a friend or watch the game.

But what I came here for is the Vietnamese geared food, with a twist. Yes, they do have food such as fries and chicken. But what caught my attention was their Beef Brisket Banh Minh Sandwich and Pork Belly Burger. Both of which were delicious! Both dished we ordered were a blend of tender meat, cooked to perfection, fresh and crisp radish and carrots. I will say that their meat does lean on the salty side. These are great when paired with their fries.

But if a burger or sandwich isn't what your craving, fear not! You have the option to opt for a salad or taste something light from their appetizers. Or, if you feel like having sweets they do have something to help you satisfy that as well. They have bread pudding, cheesecake, and chocolate budino(kind of like a cake/pudding hybrid)!

Their menu says Happy Hour EVERYDAY...but we showed up and they then said only Monday through Friday... we would have probably stayed anyway but I don't like false advertising and what a crappy way to get people in there under false pretenses

So I stopped going here a long time ago 4 reasons I just went back recently and the place is worse than before I get pulled out of the bar by the owner for talking to my friends asking them if they would like to go to another bar next weekend because they have a live ban I was going to pay the bars friend or brother whoever the other little Asian guy was goes and tells the owner that I'm trying to take business from his bar so he Yanks me outside in front of everyone and I told him what's going on his whole deal is why did I give him and his bar a 3-star rating while your servers were rude your bartenders rude plain and simple that's what the rating stars are for but now I will never step foot in there I will never recommend this place I will always recommend going somewhere else not only did he do the right thing and refund my money but soon as my wife took down her review he took the money back out double charge her then put the money back then took it back out again they made us get over fee you so we had to go to the bank in the bank looked at it and said no that's not right so this is the worst bar in Las Vegas I will not give it any stars and I will never recommend anyone spending money there ever..... well obviously it will not let me post unless I give it a star I am being forced to give it a star which is unacceptable you should be able to not give any stars you should be able to give it negative Stars I'll give it one star just so everyone can read this and be aware of this place...

595 Craft And Kitchen is just a couple minutes away from my house, so my boyfriend and I like to come here late nights after he gets off work to grab a beer and some food. They have a good selection of drinks and the food is delicious! My favorite thing on the menu is the fries with the buffalo chicken on top and their fried deviled eggs. 

The service is usually pretty good. However the past few times that we have tried to go past 12am, they're already closed. One time, I called 10 mins before coming, to ask what time they were closing and they said 2 am. After arriving, I noticed the doors were locked. I called again and the same woman picked the phone up and said they just closed. 10 mins after speaking with her!!! Although it isn't a far drive, it is still pretty disappointing to show up and the place is closed. Maybe they should change their hours of operation on Yelp or something?

It was a relief to get away from the strip for dinner. The place was casual and you could relax.  The cocktails were really well mixed and I'm picky. The menu wasn't huge but everything we ordered was good to excellent.  They have a way with pork and the spring rolls and Banh mi with pork were extra delicious.

Had high hopes when I saw all the different types of poutine on the menu so I stopped in for an early lunch. There was one large group and myself in the restaurant and the only server I saw (for a while at least) was struggling to serve both of us. I asked for a poutine recommendation and he suggested the bad ass chili poutine.  Not really badass and a very unappealing presentation.  Maybe I should have gone for the traditional poutine but still debating if I'll come back and give it a try.

Last minute idea to stop here prior to an IKEA trip.  Gastro Pub style spot with a very nice draft selection if you love craft beer . My wife and I split the garbage nachos and the hot fried chicken sandwich.  Both Very good.  Nachos has fresh guac, belly, brisket, and chicken.  Hot chicken is NOT for the weak.  It's seriously spicy and seriously delicious!  We will be back!

They get 5 stars specifically for their beer list. I'm so impressed with the menu of beer. Perfect mix of local, import, American crafts... And what a wonderful mix of styles. There were some beers on the menu that I had never heard of or tried before, and some local favorites that weren't the typical ones you see at every bar. Whoever is the buyer is doing a great job. 

If I had gone there just for food it would have been a four star review only because nothing was that impressive... almost like they were trying too hard to be crafty? Not sure can't put my finger on it, because nothing was bad... But nothing was really that good.

 I would be back anytime though for a cool laid-back ambiance great neighborhood Vibe and again best beer list ever!
Great place! Craft beers listed on the boards are excellent. Good variety of beer. Good happy hour. The staff is very friendly. Food is good. Try the fries.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon to have some beers and to share appetizers. The beer selection was amazing. Our server gave us many suggestions based on the types of beers we liked and didn't hesitate to give us a sample for anything we were unsure of. We were very pleased with our beer choices.

We ordered the Beer Cheese with pretzel bites to go along with our brews. The beer cheese was not very flavorful, but the pretzels were really fresh and tasty. We also ordered the Beer Brined Chicken Wings (buffalo flavor) which came with pickled veggies. The wings were amazing, but the pickled veggies were not great. Lastly, we ordered Chris' Bad Ass Chili Poutine. We loved it! The chili was delicious and packed with flavor. I would definitely like to come back and explore other items on their menu.

595 is definitely a gastropub- the dark, industrial redesign of the former Elements space is highlighted by a menu focusing on brews, burgers, and shareable apps. Visited with some of my favorite dudes and tried a handful of stuff on the menu. Overall consensus was that the slow-cooked pork belly is a standout but most other dishes were on the salty side- maybe this effect is lessened when there is more drinking involved.

The beer cheese app (featuring pretzel rolls from Great Buns bakery) was accented with flaked sea salt that it really didn't need. The roux-based sauce was decently smooth though. The classic poutine arrived to the table slightly cold and with an egg verging on over-hard rather than runny, but the portion size was large and the fries are made from fresh-cut potatoes which always makes them tastier. Needed more cheese curds! The sandwiches seemed to fare a bit better, with the pork belly bahn mi being thick and savory while the fried chicken sandwich (warned as being spicy) was also notably salty. Opting for a side salad over the fries might be a better option if sodium intake is an issue.

Though I don't drink, I'm told the beer list is pretty interesting. There's seating at four-tops, high-tops, and the bar, as well as a small (currently unused) patio space. So far, no word on a happy hour or any brunch offerings, but those will likely come in time. I'm open to a revisit to try a couple of other dishes; the burrata app, bundino dessert, and brisket bahn mi all sound good on paper but I'll give them a bit more time to get the kitchen flowing better.

First time at  595 Craft & Kitchen. Outstanding Banh Mi Sandwich as well as Craft Beer. Craft Beer Haven , Some Brews I' ve never heard of. Outstanding Selection. Will be back again. 
Highly Recommend ........

We were just in Vegas last weekend and we found this place right by our hotel. We were starving and looking for something quick and good to eat before going out for dinner. We found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. The place is small, but is tastefully decorated and gives off a hipster vibe. They have a lot of local beers to try but we were not familiar with any local breweries so we were happy they had some beer from San Diego that we were familiar with. We both got a Mother Earth brew. We ordered the pork belly banh mi and a small order of wings (I forget which kind we ordered though). The banh mi was great and had some of the best pork belly I've tried. The wings were decent, but very small portion, 4 wings I believe and not good enough to remember what kind we ordered and wouldn't order them again. If you're in town and want a cold beer in a cool little place, this might just be a good place to stop by!

WOW. Amazing beer selection with gorgeous chalk board art listing the taps. Everyone working there was welcoming and fun to talk to. The vibe is super calm and the happy hour wings were fantastic! All day happy hour on Sunday :D This establishment is truly a treasure, I'm glad I came in!
I love Tristen. She is just a wonderful waitress. The astomphere is wonderful and accommodating for all walks of life

Been waiting for this to open and it finally happened! All the food I saw looked great! I had the Fried Chicken Skins and the Chili, both were great! They're using local sourced where they can, like Butcher Block down the street. Tap list was seriously impressive with a wide variety of true Craft brands and styles. I ticked a few off my list last night. Next time I'm going for a burger, hearing good things about them, "each bite is like biting into a steak". I gotta experience that. I would probably had been happy with either great beer selection or mediocre beer selection and good food but we're getting stellar efforts of both! Bravo and see you next time!

They have SOUR BEER!!! First time here and we loved it. We had the crab dip and as appetizer and  Beef Brisket Banh Mi but substituted for a regular burger bun and it was delicious! The fries were fresh and the dipping sauces were awesome. Our server was attentive and super nice. We will definitely become regulars here!

Great find!!!  Just open recently.  I gave it 4 star due to service- which was slow in the beginning but did get better.  

But food didn't disappoint!!! 
We ordered the butcher block burger with bacon and egg- moist and tasty. 
The crab dip is the best dish we got- right spice and has lumps of crabs. 
The deep fried deviled egg was very good with Tye sauce it came in with. 
I'm not a big fan of poutine- but the beer cheese was good.  
We were not able to try the mix drinks and crafts BUT definitely coming back to try it.

Three words: Beer Cheese Fries!!! Absolutely delicious. Great changing beer selection. Friendly servers, even when they are slammed. The music was good, the vibe was fun, what more do you need in life?

I was not expecting to find such an outstanding Asian Fusion place in Vegas. The Banh Mi Sandwich was outstanding! The portion looked small, but it's excellent quality and I was full when I was done. I am  now disappointed in myself for leaving Vegas too early because I cannot go back.

This would be an automatic 5 Star  review if the temp inside wasn't 85degrees in the middle of a hot day. 

This bar is one of my favorites as the beer selection on tap is always rotating an eclectic variety of treats. Odell and Pure Project are hard to come by in the valley so I take a bow to you 595... get it!

Also, another highlight here is the kitchen and the amazing selections of poutine, pork belly dishes made in house, and refreshing salad compilations. I drive across town for the pork belly burger. The spicy slaw and crispy pork belly just hits the spot without fail. 

There is a metal strip that runs the bar top that is iced to keep your glass chilled as you enjoy beverage after beverage. Pretty cool idea you guys!

My new favorite place. The sides are amazing!!! I'm a vegetarian and they don't have many entree options for me, but I go just for the sides. So far I've enjoyed the service, friendly and efficient without getting in the way of your conversations.
Food was awesome. Definitely will be returning here. Great atmosphere, great music and friendly/helpful staff. I ordered the signature bah mi, and it was delicious. 5 stars!! :)

I was visiting from San Diego and a friend suggested that I try this place out. Boy was she right! The food was delicious, the beer was exceptionally cold, and the customer service was great. I ordered the Pork Belly Banh Mi, which was sexy AF. Just the right amount of spice, sweet, and savory. The fries were fresh as hell and complimented the sando perfectly. Damn good beer as well. The owners really know their sh*t. If you want to get away from the hustle & bustle of the strip and have a good beer & burger, I definitely recommend stop by and becoming a regular here. Prices are pretty decent considering the selection of brews on tap and the quality of food.

Best part for me was the cold strip!!! Never have I ever seen such a thing; keep your drinks cold on the bar. DOPE AS HELL!!!!

Incredible food and the staff was just as good. Was in town from San Diego with some friends for a spartan race and went here after for food and drinks. We order quite a few food items to share. The melted cheese dip with pretzel bites was amazing as well as the bahn mi sandwich. The  craft beer selection is perfectly paired with the food items they serve. This restaurant is an essential addition for the Las Vegas community. You will not be disappointing!
Pretty good.  Like everyone else I had the fried deviled eggs and they did not disappoint.  Bah Mi (pork), Fries, and Fried Chicken Skin.  All good along with good IPAs.  I'll be back.

Walking in, first impression: looks like a nice bar. The menu was totally unexpected. Asian fusion. Everything we ordered was amazing! The fried Deviled eggs, OMG! Game changer. The burgers are incredible. Seriously you gotta check this place out.

Prices are a bit high. Great location.  And the staff was very welcoming. It is a bit small, watched a few couples come in and leave due to minimal seating. The food is pretty bland. Decent sized selection of craft beer. Would be 5 if food was better and prices were more reasonable. 


PS. TURN ON YOUR AIR CONDITIONING!!!!

What a cool place! Just moved to the area and went here when I had family in town.  What a fun little spot for snacks and great beer and wine.  I love that there's a little gem like this in the neighborhood.   Everyone should give it a shot.
Very good selection of beer.  Service was speedy and attentive.  We got the chicken wing and poultine, it was ok, nothing special.

Their food was pretty good and the beer selection decent. It was a bit cold in the restaurant and they didn't have a beer list. You have to go up to the bar and read everything, which is inconvenient especially when it's busy. Service was decent. I'd try it again if I'm ever in the area!

Fried devil eggs appetizer-marvelous 
Pork belly burger- yummy
Tuna burger-done right
Poultine(hope I spelled this right)- enough for three people. 

We had not been back to this spot since Elements closed. As a upscale sports bar it works well. We will return.

So always had 595 on my radar. Since it was my birthday got to decide the restaurant celebrate with my roommates. Gastropub is there any better spot! You get quality craft beers from small micro brews all around the world and great food. Think not!

My frist impression nothing new reading past reviews was dam walking into dark abyss. We went for early dinner so lot of natural light out. Soon walk in think someone moved the clock forward. I missed cool buffalo head on one of the walls. Thankfully my roommate caught it in the darkness. The rolling garage door on one side that assume better weather might open it up. The bar area is small not many seats but love the way all set up. The whole place is really small. Later in the night once got pack it can get loud. Overall fan of the vibe of the whole look just think weird that the place is so dark. 

The craft beer list is TOP NOTCH. I am in no way craft expert but they have lot of beers that hardly see and nice selection from IPA, and list goes on. Our server made two great recommendations based on thinking red ale or new castle style. She like can give you sample of each. She found the perfect beer celebrate my birthday.

The food was awesome!!! It was not planned but got in on some of the HH food. We got three items for appetizers. The Fried Devil Eggs, Beer and Cheese Poutine, and Mini Banh Mi sliders (we got the signature chicken ones; if going get them HH it one per order and basically half size regular size Banh MI). The Devil Eggs never really had them fried traditional size many times. It adds another element with either panko or breadcrumbs coated on the outside. Its nice crispy outside then have perfect hard boiled egg with the filling that creamy, delicious, and addicting cause pop one in mouth just want more. The poutine fries was solid. It interesting that they have five different ones. Not many places serve it so kind of cool seeing few options besides traditional. Honest need try the traditional next go around cause not having brown gravy on it  feel off. Beer and Cheese great combination. The portion size is nice. It definitely made to share cause for one that lot of food. The little Banh Mi slider was winnah winnah chicken dinner. The bread was on point. The bread for me makes or break Banh Mi. The whole sandwich was tasty. The price was great for HH and think about portion size. One of the better HH food menus. My entree had Banh Mi before got HH ones. I got another one but tried the beef brisket one instead. It was really good. But honestly if had choose between the two would go back to the chicken or signature one. The beef brisket felt like little dried out but the filling with the sauce, vegetables, and the bread all good still. Just if had choose not order it again. 

The service was awesome. Maybe cause went for early dinner and not as busy. She was very attentive, friendly, made great recommendations on beer selection, and great service. I definitely see myself coming back to try more of the menu. Till the next time...
This is my first time here and i will be back. It reminds me San Diego or San Francisco. This is an awesome craft bar. There are so many options of beer in tap. It's bar food elevated.

Went here on a Saturday night around 11pm.
I liked the space, small but nice. Seemed like a cool little neighborhood bar. 
Unfortunately the food and service left something to be desired...
I tried to order a specialty cocktail from their menu, however it was unavailable. Then I tried to order a bacaradi and coke - no Bacardi so I had to settle on house rum. Then I tried to order pretzels and beer cheese - no pretzels.  The server offered to serve the beer cheese with pita, which I accepted. I also ordered the classic poutine.
When my drink came out it was without a straw, as they were even out of straws!! What kind of bar runs out of straws?? Very strange, especially since there is a Smiths right across the street.
The food took a long time to come out, about 20 minutes from the time I ordered and it was disappointing to say the least.... everything was cold and just not good. The beer cheese was too thick and bland. The poutine was just ok - the gravy was good but the fries were cold and soggy and the cheese curds were almost non existent. 
Overall left feeling disappointed.

Highly recommend everyone to try this place. Beers menu are amazing. Foods are delicious, especially the crab dip with pita chip. My mouth still salivates whenever I think about it. Ooh also the burgers and banh mi are also very tasty. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in town.

I typically eat a little more healthy than what's going on at this place but the food was pretty good when I had a burger and fries. I will say that the reason for the 5 stars is actually the bartender. He was awesome and gave us some good tips for betting on the Mayweather fight.

I live in Summerlin and was craving fried chicken skin. I usually make the drive down to the UNLV area, to a Pinoy joint, to get my fix. Being as it was late and I was feeling extra lazy, I decided to find a place that offered it close by. 

We ordered pickup and customer service was pleasant. I'm giving two stars based on the food. The chicken skin had too much breading on it and I could barely taste the skin. It literally just tasted like breading. My boyfriend ordered buffalo wings and we could barely taste the buffalo sauce!! It was just fried chicken wings/thighs. I'll take a pass.

Being from Vegas this place is so cool to me.
First of all it closes at 2am. I know, typically, people hate this but I'm born and raised in Vegas and any place that doesn't let me stay there all night is a win in my book! That means that I know for certain my boyfriend can't convince me to stay out longer than 2, and we get to say we closed the bar down ! Second of all, there's no gaming and you can't smoke inside. Yes and yes ! I won't lose extra money feeding the game machine after I've had too much to drink! I also won't come home smelling like an ashtray. 

We came on a Friday night and it wasn't packed but they were busy enough. It took awhile for anybody to come around and take our order which is where the one star drops off. Whenever they did come around (which wasn't often) they were really nice though. In the corner they have a ton of games you can choose from to play with your friends. Our group chose exploding kittens! We had a really great time :).

Also we all ordered different things and every one of us was pleased with our selections. The deviled eggs, hummus, spring rolls, and pork bun were all a hit at our table ! Will definitely be back to try out more craft beers, more of their food menu, and to play some games while doing so.

Good hangout spot !

We love this neighborhood bar/restaurant. Great friendly service, great craft brews on tap, consistent food, and fun atmosphere. They show all Vegas Knights games and their happy hour menu has great options and prices. I highly recommend 595 Craft Kitchen and will continue to visit as often as I can.

I had lunch here with the wife and was a little put off with the menu options regarding the burgers.  I just wished that the fries would be added together with a burger instead of being ordered separately ala carte style.  Maybe I'm not up to par with this new hustle. Figured a neighborhood joint would have been a little more menu friendly.

The beers were pretty good but the food and service was very average. My burger was pretty undercooked for a medium well. I think the biggest drawback is how small it is. If you like to be tight with your table next to you then it's probably ok. I just wish they had actual menus for the beers on tap because I couldnt really make out the board with my crappy contacts.
My favorite destination for food and beer. Their Craft burger is hard to beat. The Banh Mis are amazing. And best of all, they always have a great beer list on tap.

Came back for a 3rd time and ordered the chili cheese burger for a 2nd time. One thing I noticed is that the fries were better than the 1st time. The first time they tasted plain or too salty if anything. Today they had a little pepper flavor to it. I enjoyed my chili cheeseburger AGAIN and I added bacon this time I also got more into the craft beer this go/round since I've been trying to step my craft beer game up. I tried the green flash IPA and I'm not an IPA guy. It was solid. I ordered a heffawizen and an orange blood kolsch. All of the beers were good. What's cool is if you are into craft beer is that they continuously switch up their beer menu. The bartenders and other servers were very attentive . I noticed they had a power outlet up front at the bar which was a plus for me since my phone is always dead lol .  The 1st time I came by they didn't have wifi . This time they did. For a craft beer/west coast comfort food spot this  place seems to be on the up & up to me.

I cruised by 595 for lunch with 2 of my coworkers.

FOOD:  The fried chicken skins were pretty bland. The sweet chili sauce was the only thing that saved it. I think they should use soy sauce + vinegar + chopped onions as a dip instead.  Their signature banh mi was pretty good. It looks like they use higher quality ingredients. But, for $9 I don't think it's worth it .

SERVICE:  3/5.  Im guessing it took around 15-20 min for all of us to our food.

AMBIENCE:  3/5.  It's a small restaurant with a bar.  It's quiet in there, too.

I may try 595 one more time.  Mostly for the drinks though.

Ok so I have been dying to check out this place and luckily we came during happy hour. 
I am only giving this place 2 stars instead of one just because our server Amy was very friendly. 
The beer selection is nice. 
My friend had one of their specialty drinks and she wasn't crazy for it..
We had the hummus which came with super hard pita chips... suggestion, maybe something softer like pita bread..? Otherwise hummus itself was tasty. 
The chicken wings were dry and over cooked. Didn't care much for the sauces. 
The "crispy" chicken skins were ok. They weren't too crispy and a bit soggy. Maybe just not fried long enough. 
My friend asked for no tomatoes in her $9 salad. Tons of tomatoes in it! Good thing she wasn't allergic but did end up getting real sick.
The deep fried deviled eggs were just ok. One piece was enough for me...
The Bahn mi slider, or whatever it's called was not good. Hardly no taste and mostly just bread. Waste. 
Overall, we were not satisfied with the food. Service was great! Beer was yummy. 
Small and cozy place. They just need to improve their food. 
Oh and those sheets the food comes on....really? 2 eggs on something that big? We hardly had any room on our tables for everything because of all those metal sheets. Cute but not necessary. Focus more on the taste of the food rather than the presentation please:)

Best selection of rotating beers in the city I've seen thus far. Amazing food! Give the pork belly burger a try, just fantastic. Bartenders are all friendly and knowledgeable. Overall great experience.
Small but we loved the food and service. We ordered the deviled eggs and wings both amazing. I had a cocktail named the Trinidad a must have if you like bourbon just delicious.

Tried 595 for the first time and I'm hooked!! This place isn't your average bar! It's small (which is nice for a change) and it's Asian fusion! The interior is very welcoming they have a garage door window that I assume they raise when the weather is nice. They have a few games in the corner that you can play while you wait or as a social thing if you're with friends. The food is spectacular also my mom and I went and I had the pork belly burger, she had the chili cheese burger and we split the beer cheese fries!! YYYUUUUMMMMMMMM is all I can say! The one suggestion I have maybe indicating on the menus items that are spicy. I know we could've asked as well but sometimes it's nice to know ahead of time. The chili on the burger had a pretty good kick to it.

Nice appetizers, during happy hour and even better pricing! We popped in to try happy hour before a movie and enjoyed a variety of foods including delicious fried deviled eggs 5/5, crispy chicken skins with a good sauce to dip in 4/5, hand cut house fries 4/5, honey soy chicken bahn mi slider 5/5, signature bahn mi slider 3/5, beer brined chicken wings 3/5 and lastly the Chris' BAD ASS chili 4/5. I would say my favorite things were the fried deviled eggs and the chicken skins, both unique and tasty.

Everything we tried we shared three ways amongst friends. The seating area in 595 Craft and Kitchen was very limited so we were lucky to get in and seated for their Happy Hour (which lasts 3-6 PM and then midnight to close). People around us were trying other items and we all chatted about how good the food was. All of the servers were friendly and very helpful. Enjoy the pics and give this place a try for yourself!

Amazing. Don't drive by - stop in.  We almost did and it would have been a major oversight.  The cook is not a chef - more like an artist and the Pork Belly Banh Mi is his masterpiece. The Ice Box Buttermilk Cheesecake is not only fantastic it is served like no other cheesecake I've seen. I have traveled the country on business and have had the fortune to eat at some very good restaurants, on top of that Las Vegas is blessed with some extremely good locally owned ones - 595 Craft & Kitchen ranks as one of the best and has made my Vegas must do list. Some restaurants in Vegas I go back and order my favorite. This place is so good I intend to try something different on the menu each visit.

Industrial rustic feel... Sports on 4 big screens! The Fried Deviled Egg an absolute must try!! I am southern and had never had them before- on my fun foodie list now!!, Green Cabbage Salad light and full of flavor - if ur med to mild spice eater, have them hold back a bit on the  - The Vermicelli Noodle Salad equally tasty , all stand out must try's! Service friendly & complete knowledge of the menu - for an after work or weekend brewsky the place to be! a solid 4 Stars!

Food was ok. Place was small. Slow service. No communication between workers. Had hard one getting our orders correctly. I was excited to try this place out but was disappointed. I don't know what else to say.

Excellent gastropub in Spring Valley that isn't obnoxiously loud with patrons drunk on beer. Everything from the food to the service was five stars for me. The gastropub itself isn't too big, so we had one server serve us the entire time. She had a smile on her face the entire time when she attended to us and did so genuinely. Everything from taking our orders promptly, to filling our water cups, to correcting a minor hiccup along the way was spot on. You can tell, this business truly emphasizes excellent customer service. 

My boyfriend and I skipped the variety of beers they have on tap because we aren't avid beer drinkers and can't appreciate it. But we did try their burgers and sides.

The badass pork belly burger ($13) was really badass. There were slices of fatty pork belly on top of a burger patty, and cole slaw. I also added a farm egg for $2 extra. The combination was filling and tasty. The red peppers in the cole slaw gave the burger a mild kick and was surprising to the tongue. I added a simple salad as a side for $3 extra. The salad came with mixed greens, carrots, cumcubers, tomatoes, radish and a light citrus vinaigrette. 

The chili burger ($12) was chili atop a hamburger patty. Although the chili was tasty, the burger itself was a bit dry. Be prepared to get down and dirty with this burger because it will get messy. A side of fries were added to this order for $3 extra and it came with a side of aioli dipping sauce. 

For dessert, we tried the Reese's bread pudding. Save room for dessert because this decadent peanut butter and chocolate dish is too good to skip. Sticks of bread are stacked atop one another and served with a side of sweet whipped cream and crumbs. The portion is pretty hefty too and can serve up to 4 people!

I will definitely be coming back to try all the other dishes 595 has to offer. This place is truly a gem.

Great pub food, excellent beer selection, and friendly service.  A great local bar all around.  We went there last night and had a great time at the bar.  The Chilli Cheese fries are spectacular, although I suspect not very low calorie.  We will be back.

The rise of gastropubs have reached an apex in the valley; many of which offer a wide variety of beers to tickle ones curiousity. 595 is no exception. A solid combination of stouts, ales and sours can fill up your beeradvocate card quickly. I came for the Belching Beaver Mexican Peanut Butter Stout and the Cherry Sour. The one impressive and ever changing trait is the menu. Yes, they do have the typical bar favorites as the hamburger and fries, but they include banh mis, poutine, and other savory dishes that beats the usual "x food pairs with y beer" archtype. The crispy chicken skins are so devishly delicious.

If you like beer this is your spot! Constantly rotating beer on tap and always unique finds. The food is great as well, their fried deviled eggs are by far the most phenomenal thing you have tasted, creative twist on a deviled egg and so worth a couple orders ;-). Tristian and Kasey are amazing, they are the only staff I have really interacted with since I always make it a point to stop in and say hi to these lovely folks. They are fun, welcoming, knowledgeable, personable, and know how to connect the patrons at their bar to make for a lively social setting. I have met some really awesome people at 595! Great little gem here in Vegas, that's for sure! Do yourself a favor and stop by next time you're on this side of town grab a cold beer and an order of the fried deviled eggs!!

Getting 5 stars from me is easy when a place does the simple things right.

595 is an owner operated business with a great Staff, great service (I sat at the bar), tasty well executed bar food (I had the Chicken sandwich, the deviled eggs, the cashew hummus and the house chili) and a bunch of really tasty beers and cocktails.

That's it, what else can you ask for. I will upload pictures later. Also check out Meraki Grill next door it's amazing.

I'm a little hesitant to write a review, as I want to keep this place all to myself! Some friends and I went here last night for dinner and drinks and will most certainly being going back soon. It was packed when we arrived. It's open seating, so we found a little shelf rail bar to sit at in the back.
The wait staff was prompt, friendly and knowledgeable. They have a great selection of very tasty beers. The food was top notch. I ordered the heirloom tomato salad with added (seared) tuna. Best. Decision. Ever. I highly recommend it. They don't have freezers so everything they make is fresh. Their pricing reflects this, but it is still worth it.
Outstanding selection of craft beer that's complimented by great food and a wonderful staff.

The food is okay. Nothing too spectacular. The hot chicken sandwich has no flavor and the breading just falls off. What really kept me coming back for so long was the service, now that the best bartender is gone, I don't think I shall be returning.
Extremely impressed by this place. Great food and huge selection of beer. Love the decor. Even the bathrooms are decked out. Kiddos.
Las Vegas finally has a real craft pub. Excellent Asian fusion menu. Great rotating taps. Non-smoking. Welcome to 2017.

Sometimes don't you just wanna have a cold one after a long day (especially these 100+ days) without the crowd that's poking you with their pool sticks? 595 is perfect!  Indoor and outdoor seating, tons of speciality brews!  We've been here a couple times and the wait staff have always been attentive and friendly!  Both times we let them recommend something for us and it never disappoints! Not to mention, Chef Van whips up some delish finger food that compliments the drinks!  Definitely recommend for just to unwind or to catch the game with some buddies!

The fries are amazing and their selection of beer is bomb! It's a bit small but a great little place to stop for a bite to eat with friends! They also have a lunch deal, if you order a burger or their banh mi sandwich you get a side for free :)

A small bar with big tasty bites! Walked in on a whim Friday for lunch and both the fried deviled eggs and Nashville hot chicken were jaw-droppingly delicious! The staff was friendly and accommodating. The beer and cocktail menu looked wonderful. Looking forward to a weekend night visit.

I have been coming into this bar now for a little over a year now. The food is pretty decent and the atmosphere has always been really awesome, especially when the Knights are playing.. Mostly because of the bartenders and their witty banter with the guests at the bar. 
I went in for the playoff game and immediately asked for my favorite bar tender, Tristian (who usually works on Wednesday's) and was told that she is no longer with the company..
To be honest, she is the kind of person who makes all experiences memorable, all bad days better and all heavy days lighter. Isn't that why most regulars frequent places such as these? Yes. And that is why 595 became my regular dwelling place.. Now that this special soul is gone, I can't imagine myself coming back here. It feels empty and lifeless. 
When you find employees who have such an impact on their patrons, one should be mindful and keep them around. She touched my life and I know she touched others in an extremely positive way. 
595 will never be the same in my opinion.
Good beer, good people, good food, good atmosphere. Eat the food stay for a drink talk to people. What else do you want? Go knights!
Very good food place.  Food is very good and a bit different from other places.  The beer selection is extensive.  Service was solid.  I'll definitely be back!

Fried chicken skin. Burrata with apricot chutney. Fried deviled eggs. Chartreuse-based drinks. I could go on. 

This place is a must for locals and tourists alike. It's like someone climbed into my mind and snatched the menu from my heart. 

Visit this place soon. You won't be sorry.

There aren't enough eateries, let alone craft kitchens that serve food made in house, down to the sauces. They support local business and promote local brews, which makes this place a cornerstone for good eats. The ambiance is fantastic, with tables that have that butcher block nouveau feel. It's comfortable and the service is fantastic. What's even better is the food.

The menu has an amazing variety of Asian and American fare, from their in-hoise cured pork belly to the Butcher Block (the Vegas meat vendor, yes) burger, and their varieties of poutine. We have the chicken wings, Asian style, and their made from scratch burrata with ginger apricot chutney a try for starters. The wings hit hard with great soy and gochuchang flavor, crispy on the first bite, and finger licking good--literally.  The burrata is a gentle cloud of cheese goodness that is enhanced by the chutney. 

The butcher block burger is so well seasoned and cooked to perfection that squeezing down with my fingers against the bun bring out a lot of juice. The toppings don't overpower the great flavor of the burger itself, but compliment it with every bite. On top do the beautiful bun, it's a perfect meal with or without fries. However, the fries here are made with love, so I strongly suggest ordering a side with aioli. The hot Fried chicken is spicy, crunchy goodness topped with cool lettuce and pickles. It's just a great chicken sandwich that satisfies any southern chicken cravings. I highly recommend the poutine made with gravy made in house and some cheese curds and a fried egg. Lovely, crispy fries that don't get soggy even with gravy, it was creamy, perfectly flavored goodness. I wanted to lick the paper! I know now that every visit here will include poutine no matter what.

Dessert was amazing, served in the cutest jars and with crumbles that felt like my childhood cookie dreams on a plate. The dark chocolate dessert topped with sea salt and crumble, olive oil drizzle and roasted hazelnuts was crunchy, chocolate goodness. Almost close to a ganache but still at a mousse consistency, I enjoyed every chocolatey, nutty bite. Their cheesecake topped with yuzu and served with strawberries and a shortbread crumble with olive oil drizzle made my night! Light, citrus tones and sweet cookie crumble made this dessert a must for those wanting a sweet but light finish.

Paired with local beers, each part of the experience was fun and a true experience. I love the fact that the owner and chef work hard to make everything from scratch, because it shows with every bite. I appreciate the care and love in the food, and look forward to our trip through the menu soon. 

Followers, you know how my five stars don't come easy. Trust me when I say this place deserves five full stars. You won't regret eating here, ever.

Went there 3 times. First time the service was great. Bartender was very helpful in suggesting some different craft beers. Food was really good also. The second and third time the service was terrible. Different bartenders both times. I was going to eat but after my first beer was done they never came over to see if I wanted another or if I wanted to order food. Won't be returning

Stopping for a bite to eat before an appointment.  I passed this place on my way to Applebee's - immediately pulled up the menu and turned around.  I love finding neighborhood gems.  The food was so good and the Pineapple Cider was heavenly.  This is a place for beer lovers, girls night, boys night, date night or catching up on work.  Definitely coming back.
Nice little kitchen/ bar/ restaurant. Lunch specials, happy hours, good food portioned and priced good. Only been once but will likely be back if in the neighborhood.

So excited when I saw them moving In to the spot on rainbow which is right next to my house. I'm kind of new to las Vegas and came to the unfortunate conclusion that the craft beer scene here is horrible. 595 craft and brewery is a hoppy oasis in the barren desert of las Vegas. Not the biggest selection but it's beers you actually WANT to drink. Well done 595. Well done.

Came here on a suggestion from a bartender at a nearby place. We came around 4:30 on 420. They had a lot of specials for 420 with 4.20 beers. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the bartender. The service was okay. I felt like because we ordered regular cocktails  it wasn't the full on craft experience. We had trouble with some of the ingredients on the menu and the bartender helped us out but I felt like she was annoyed. No biggie we ordered our drinks Queen Bee, Daquiri and the C + E. The drinks were good. Really strong. There happy hour menu was pretty good. We ordered the spicy crab dip. The dip was a 10. Served with crackers and pita bread. Will definitely be coming back for the food!

I love it here! This is definitely my type of bar. Since I'm not too knowledgeable about what kind of beers I like, I asked the bartender for recommendations and he gave me a couple different options to taste to find which one I want to commit to. I've been here a few different times and each time I had a different style of beer that I really liked! Their taps are constantly rotating but I know that there's always going to be something I'll like when I come. I give them a ton of props for bringing more craft beer to Vegas!

Now onto the munchies! There are so many good things on the menu that I love. 

For appetizers I highly recommend the fried deviled eggs and the chicken skins. Both are super addicting! 

For main dishes all the banh mis are fiiirrree. If you don't know what a banh mi is, crawl out from under that rock and welcome to the best sandwich you've ever had. The hot fried chicken sandwich is also everything I've ever wanted in a chicken sandwich. Make sure to ask for the home made buttermilk (ranch) dressing for your sandwich and fries. It's bomb diggity. 

Right now they have a pumpkin spice bread pudding that makes you forget it's still 80 degrees in October. I also love that it comes with home made whipped cream on top. 

TL:DR Come for the craft beer selection; stay for the sandwiches!

I was really excited to take my family from out of town here. I had been wanting to try this place for a while. I am sad to say I won't be returning. 

Beer: the selection was awesome! The prices were really good for draft beers. This is the only part that deserves more than 2 stars. 

Service: our waiter seemed seriously annoyed that he had to wait on us. Party of 6 that included 2 kids and 4 adults. If you can't act happy to serve people you need to be sent home. 

Food: mediocre at best. We ordered a salad it was ok. 2 appetizers that came out with our meals. The kids food came out very last and it was the chili. The temperature of the chili was so hot we had to add several ice cubes to it. Not acceptable. We also ordered A bob mi sandwich that was tasteless. 

They did have games for the family to play. That was a plus.

Great variety in the selection of craft beer! It was great to taste anything I wanted but a lot of the beers tasted a little... off... first one was so odd I almost questioned if the tap lines were dirty. I did end up finding a few pints to drink so maybe it was my taste buds that were funky that night (to be fair). We asked to watch a UFC fight and ended up feeling guilty for wanting to watch it- the bartender was pretty passive aggressive in communicating that it wasn't something she wanted on the tv (which was a bummer because other bar guests ended up watching and enjoying with us!) Food was interesting but not delicious. In fairness we knew the food options and still chose to try the place based on the beer. With all the options in town, we won't go back.
Damn that poutine is delicious!!! I will definitely be coming back for this again the next time I'm in Vegas!!!

PERFECT 10! Food is outstanding you can't go wrong here. I was in town for business and running last minute errands that luckily brought me near 595 Craft plenty of brews on tap as good as any high end Vegas strip eatery. My compliments to the Chef.

I came here for the first time with some friends last night. This place is everything a gastropub should be.  The beer selection was great. All crafted and seasonal beers. The menu was a perfect compliment to the beers. Deep fried chicken skins, need I say more. Can't wait to come back.

Came in here for lunch yesterday and ended up getting the spicy chicken sandwich and a side of the fries with the traditional gravy. Ow so good!!! 
The chicken sandwich had a sauce that was very unique. It tasted like the hot Nashville chicken from KFC! But better. 
I didn't drink bc it being my lunch hour, but there seemed to be quite the selection of beers and drinks on the board. The wait was above average for the crowd that was in there but giving the quality of the food I'm okay with that. Can't wait to come back and try some of the other things on the menu as the other burgers that they had listed looked pretty intriguing as well.

I love a good beer so we decided to come check out this new place near our home. They have a great selection of beers on tap. I tried the pineapple flavored beer which was a little too sweet for my taste but still drinkable. As far as food, the deviled eggs are a must try, the fried chicken burger was awesome, and the bahn mi sandwich was pretty good as well. They just opened a couple months ago so they seem to be finding their groove. Service was a little slow but the place was packed so it's understandable. There was also a lot of confusion with food orders. A few dishes came out to our table that we're meant for other tables but we told them we didn't order them and they figured it out. There's a few menu items we still want to try so we'll be back sometime soon.

My husband and I came in on a Monday night to have a few beers and snacks. Beer was great and the food was above average. I'd heard about the hummus being pretty great but wasn't really head over heels about it. The wings were just so-so as well. The loco moco fries though, they were excellent and even let us add a slice of pork belly on top. For dessert, we shared the pudding and it was great except for the peanut oil that is drizzled on the plate...that's not a good flavor combination. I suggest honey or anything else but peanut oil. Place wasn't very busy, cooks and staff seemed bored. Very clean establishment, clean bathrooms and adequate space. Since this sits on the corner of Tropicana and Rainbow, I'd hope that they continue to get more business.

Talk about good karma, we happened to be in this part of town and I checked Yelp. What a find, super interesting menu, super tasty and super clean! Loved our food. I had the signature banh-mi and my partner had a burger.  He said his burger was one of the best he had eaten lately and would order it again.  I have eaten banh-mi sandwiches all over Las Vegas and this one really stands out, just the right amount of heat.  Great selection of beer. Van brought 2 samples and we ordered a Sierra Nevada. I appreciated the friendly staff, maybe the owner, who checked to see if everything was OK. They will be opening a patio soon. The decor was interesting with a variety of lights and paneling. Important to me was a very clean bathroom.  They need more eye level exterior signage because they are in a strip mall with several other restaurants and their sign is really high up.

Just walked out of there with an order to go-salad greens w/tasty grilled chicken w/citrus dressing  and HOLY SHIT BALLS it's good! I think I LOVE that place now lol!

Cool owners
Good vibes 
And obviously GOOD chef!

Probably my 10th time here. Gets better everytime. I have had a majority of the food. It's all great. I think the deviled eggs are a bit expensive for what you get... but they are still fire(really good). Hot fried chicken sandwich is my favorite sandwich and the hoisin sambal beer chicken wings are dank(even better). Beer and cider taps are epic and I always finish with a somtging out of there broad whiskey selection. High west campfire was tonight's selection. Kasey is the best. Then there is a really sweet Irish girl who's name I forget. But point blank period. Food, drinks and service is off the chain.

Pretty cool gastropub! We ordered the fried deviled eggs and the Thai Spicy Hummus. I personally preferred the deviled eggs. 595 had a real nice selection of beer on tap and bottles. I was a little disappointed that they didn't carry my IPA brand, but the waitress recommended a real good beer based on my description. :)

Great beer list and friendly service. I dig the thai hummus, which is served in a big wok with great pita chips. I'm really glad a place like this is on this side of town. I wish they had a couple straight up vegan options I don't have to modify when I order, but they get an extra point for playing the new Tribe Called Quest album in its entirety. Can't wait to get back to this place.
Fried devil eggs were amazing!!  Food, two beers, perfect service, and the World Series playing for less than $20. Unbeatable. You won't be disappointed.

This review is for 4.5 stars.

I really liked 595.  I didn't expect to be blown away but the bahn mi I had was the largest version I've ever had and tasty to boot.  I added an egg and the soggyness created a perfect addition.  The beer menu is quite good with a bunch of unknown San Diego breweries on draft.  They let you sample which I always enjoy, though no flights were offered.  The entrees ranged from $9-13 and the beers were around $6-7.  Plenty of TVs and high tops make it a great spot to watch some sports if in the area.  The food is very unique with a Vietnamese entree feel, but also specializing in poutine and fries.  Overall I really enjoyed 595 and recommend it as a new beer locale in the city.

This bar is small, but has a good ambiance. They have plenty of choices for beers and offer a few signature cocktails. My friend and I sat at the bar and all the bartenders that helped us were friendly. They also let me try a couple of their beers before I decided. It took a while for us to get our bill though and we had to ask twice. Their food is quite average. Portions are generous, but flavors are not all there. We shared the furikake tuna burger, the crispy chicken skins, and the traditional poutine. We like the crispy chicken skins the most (the one at carson kitchen is way better though). Tuna burger was edible, but nothing special. I say skip the poutine. The fries was soggy and flavorless and the gravy was tasteless. I'd go back for their beers, but not for their food.

Quite a gem... delicious, Vietnamese-inspired takes on food.  My workmates and I stopped in for lunch and 595 Craft scored 4/4.  We enjoyed the Vermicelli Noodle Salad, Spring Rolls, a Butcher Block Craft Burger and the Beer Cheese Poutine.  Each dish had a twist that made it noteworthy.  Our server was great!  He made informed recommendations
that added to our meal.  We'll definitely be back for more food and to try out some of the local craft beers.

The hardest part is finding places that accommodate large parties. I came here with 12 people in my group for my birthday. They don't do reservations but I gave a head notice cuz of how big my party was. 

Not only was the manager Van accommodating, we loved our server. I don't remember her name. Sorry! She was really sweet and upbeat. I almost thought she was gonna cream me with my birthday cake. Lmao. But my friend had already done that -_-.

I got the Bahn Mi special. People said they don't toast this but it is toasted. It's just lightly toasted, it's not rock hard like Lee's sandwich. But a little extra toasty would give it the right texture. Flavor was good however my friends had a hard time because of how spicy it was. 

I loved it because I'm always asking for extra jalape√±os. But if you're not digging the spicy, I'd suggest asking for none. I had two in mine and it was pretty kicking. 

I also ordered the poutine! It was so good! I haven't had it since I was in Vancouver. But it was just delicious! I honestly wanted to eat all of it but I was too full. 

My friend got the crab dip that we shared. It was with imitation crab. I think this was my least favorite item. 

I also had ordered a queen bee. It was so yummy I had to have two! I think all their drinks hit the spot with my group. And our server recommended some drinks to everyone! 

Thank you for accommodating us and making our dining experience fun to the staff!

Visited here from Dallas and let me say, no regrets whatsoever. Javier, the bartender, and Phan the owner were awesome. Incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, beer and cocktails/liquor. The hummus was absolutely amazing. We also got the hot chicken sandwich and pork belly burger and both items had such intense, wonderful flavors. If you're looking for a 'regulars' and 'locals' kind of spot this is your go-to.

I came here for happy hour awhile back. It's super intimate as the space isn't huge but it's got such a great vibe to it. Love that it's around the corner from me. The food was super yummy, and the selection of beers is great. I look forward to coming back and trying out some other things on the menu.

Fantastic food and great beer list.  The Furikake Tuna Burger is epic and the Pork Belly Burger is about as good as you could imagine.  Go for the side of House Fries--hot, crispy and juicy with a fry sauce that has a delightful kick. Did we mention the beer list?! We'll be back soon!

Came here for lunch because Miraki the Greek  kabob place was so busy.  The bar with a vast selection of draft beers looks interesting,  but came in for a quick lunch.
The waitress got our drink order then after we decided on our lunch choices, we waited to order and waited and waited...
She clearly is playing the "I'm busy" game. Yes, she is by herself in the dining area, but with 3 other tables occupied it's not New years eve in there. She is busing tables and ignoring us
Priority is to take our order and as we are waiting she can bus a table, but no we didn't exist. 
I finally got up and asked her to attend to us. She acted surprised like 'oh you want to eat?"
I guess the food was ok, the crab dip was oily and no good. Everything else was average, but the waitresses attitude spoiled the lunch. Left a basic tip because of her poor service.
What causes this? I have no idea.
I will wait in line at the Greek place next time.
