Walked in and right away noticed their rustic style and woodwork interior. I love stuff like this!! 

Not just a pub but a Gastro pub! They focus on high- quality food then a regular pub. Very unique menu not often seen. I'm pretty sure there's no other pub in town like this. Right away I noticed crispy chicken skin on their menu. That was to die for. The skin was fried perfectly. It comes with a dipping sauce was so good!! I devoured that too!! 

Now I'm a very picky eater when it comes to banh mi sandwiches. Meat needs to be tender and has to have lots of good flavors and bread needs to be perfect, not hard. I can't believe a place like this makes one of the best Banh mi sandwich!! 

For those times you just feel like getting a drink and eating some really good food 595 craft and kitchen is the place! I will definitely be back to try their burgers and desserts.
I went there with a big group and maybe it's not the better way to judge the quality of food and service. So I will give a next try with my husband. By now, it's just okay.
Good food with really friendly employees.  It's great we get a place like this off strip for the locals.

Sitting in a quaint plaza on Tropicana and rainbow, the restaurant emblazoned 595 sticks out from behind the chevron. With a rustic bar look, the place is very casual, selling their interesting beer menu look.

The staff was friendly, easily asking any questions I had.

The food was great too! Would I come back though? Probably not. Their menu is very similar to many Vietnamese fusion places in town, but with different quirks, such as poutine. The restaurant puts out a wide variety of dishes; while all delicious, are not to the level of similar restaurants such as District One or Bachi Burger. Take this with a grain of salt since these are just my taste buds preferring a less "hearty" menu.

The place is delicious to try if you are in the mood, however I believe there are current just better options than 595.

Quickly becoming my favorite spot for grubs in Vegas. They're a new joint - and doing quite well so it seems. 

Went in Wednesday night (the place is tucked away behind the rainbow Walgreens) - and was blown away. Cute place (tiny, but still seemingly ample seating), great decor, awesome vibe with the music - reminds me of a bar I would visit in beach town Charleston, SC. 

Amazing service on Wednesday. Offered to sample many beers I wasn't familiar with. Ended up doing a beer/food pairing. Van, took great care of me and was very enthusiastic about my food selections. Always a good vibe when they get hyped about how you're eating the food. 

Outstanding food. Seriously. Incredible. And very very fair priced. A side of out-of-this-world pork belly is very generous for $5. I went in alone, and crushed..

-an appetizer of the fried deviled eggs (being from the south - this was a foodgasm) // paired with blueberry wheat
-Mixed greens salad with the garlic chicken and pork belly (omfg. Awesome. And they have chopsticks to enjoy the food slowly as intended) // paired with farmhouse ale
-Nutella Dark Chocolate Almond Bread Pudding (I shared a photo with a friend.. this is a party in your mouth) // paired with cali' creamin. 

The dessert was so damn good I almost ordered a second round. Except by this point I was stuffed. 

SO I CAME BACK ON THURSDAY. I had to try the burgers. Had to. And god, am I glad I did. Also incredible. Perfect bun. 

Only downside? Menu offered grilled or fried onions.. grilled onions gross me out so I asked for fried. They're still grilled.. bartender told me he meant to tell me that. Service tonight was okay, but not as mind blowing as Wednesday - they seemed preoccupied with personal convos. But no biggie. The food made up for it!! And the place is new, so turnover is bound to happen while ironing it out! Besides, once I got my bread pudding, all was forgotten. 

Will definitely be back. And again soon.

OK very important spot. I don't even want it to grow in popularity because I want it to be mine and only mine. But that's selfish; this place deserves applause. 

Me and my girlfriend have pronounced 595 as our numero UNO favorite bar/gastropub in town. It hits all the buttons and makes for a great experience consistently every time. Upon 5 visits I find more reasons to love the spot and plan on making a habit on coming more. 

The food is SO DARN GOOD. Perhaps the biggest distinguishing factor of this spot. True personality dashed on each dish, it's really hard to go wrong anywhere on the menu. The Vietnamese fusion of classy gastropub dishes is evident throughout the menu and makes for tough selection every time. So far our hands down favorites are that ridiculous dynamite dip (R U kidding this idea is gold) and the banh mi (classic, porkbelly WHATEVA). The beer selection is great too I always try a new IPA every time I stop in!

One of the biggest reasons for our returning is the consistently amazing service and company of the bartenders, especially Charles. That guy is truly awesome, remembered us after our first visit and is so welcoming every time we come back. He balances his dope company with solid service like a true professional and really completes the whole visit. Thank you Charles and thank you 595 for being such an awesome lil joint for us to loiter!
Love this place, craft beer and bar food with great staff. Only wish it was closer to home!
Three words; Fried Deviled Eggs. Must try. Service is remarkable, serving sizes are hefty and prices and VERY reasonable. You must stop by.
Good food and good beer. Cool atmosphere. People weren't super friendly but not rude. Works for me. It's a bit on the pricey side. $9-$10 for a beer and $9 for 4 deviled eggs....

I went to 595 last night and was blown away. Van is killing it. The food here is awesome. I had the pork belly burger. It was so damn good. The fries are the best fries I've ever had...not kidding. They double fry them. The fries deviled eggs...Service was also great. Beer selection was fantastic. One thing I loved was learning how 595 got its name, as well as some of the local Vegas history with the old race track. This is one of those spots where I don't want anyone to go because I want it all to myself.

Great rotating craft beers! Very small bar but it's great to stop in and grab a beer you typically can't find at any other local bar. I usually have to go downtown to find beers like this. Very nice to have near home.

I reaaaaally enjoyed this find! Came in at 1 am, during the late night happy hour and sat at the bar. The decor is nice and reminded me of a bar in California. They have a nice selection of beers. I came in because I saw they had Cali Creamin' on tap from a photo another yelper posted. When I asked for it I was told that this bar rotated through their beers so they don't always have the same selections. I thought that was an awesome way to keep people coming back to try different beers. The  counter is super cool! I didn't realize it until the end, but the silver panel is meant to keep your drinks cold.

They let you sample if you want. They have a nice selection of sours which a lot of breweries don't have in Las Vegas. Their happy hour menu is good, I definitely recommend pairing the food with a beer or a drink. It is definitely drunk food lol, salty and fried everything. But even if you don't drink the food is still a plus. 

I ordered
-fried chicken skins
-fried deviled eggs
-chicken banh mi
-original banh mi

I liked everything! I love fried chicken skins (especially from Carson Kitchen), but these were different. They reminded me more of chicharon with the texture and the breading on it and the sauce was like vinegar. If you're Filipino then you'll know what Im talking about lol. I liked it, they give you a large portion. The deviled eggs were delicious, I've never had them fried before. And both of the banh mis were good! I appreciated the fact that the bread was on the softer side because nothing sucks more than bread that cuts the inside of your mouth (ahemmm Lee's). 

The bartender there was awesome, she definitely was cool to talk to and told us a lot about the place. The owners are from San Diego, which to me, made more sense of the beer selection, decor, and ambiance. They have cool events to look forward to, and they are planning to come out with a brunch menu on Saturday's and Sunday's. I can't wait for that because who doesn't love brunch? I will be coming back!

Hubby and I ate here tonight and loved it. Chelsea and Mark were our servers and recommended delish food and cocktails. Fried  deviled eggs, crab dip, hamburger, pork belly bahn mi were all exceptional! Craft beer (local and from Cali) and craft cocktails. Who can beat that? Chelsea and Mark were fab: sweet, friendly, and attentive. Awesome music and a vibe that reminds us so much for cool joints in Sonoma/Napa/Bay Area/So Cal.b

Stopped in for a bite, ordered the fried deviled eggs and cashew hummus. Great choices.  Everything that  followed was spot on, great presentation.
The bar staff was super, chatting
It up with us making our first day in your beautiful state amazing. 
Ty

A group of us had an early dinner around 5pm here yesterday. I called them before going and found out they don't take reservations. 
Upon entering, found this place small but hip and chill. 

Athough beer is the main attraction, the owners are seeking to establish the gastropub as a family-friendly community hangout. It's great it's a no-smoking and no-gaming place.

The menu is interesting, unique and reasonably priced.

I skipped the variety of beers as I'm not a beer fan. I had their Sparking wine and my bf had their Cocktails called Gordon's Cup that consists of Gin + Cucumber + Mint + Fresh Lime. It was tasty but not strong.

Their craft beers are from all over and they let you sample if you want.

Some of the food ordered were-
Garbage Nachos from the Special menu
Pork Belly Burger
Chicken Skins: breaded, slightly spicy.
Pork Belly Bahn Mi: added an egg on it, it's my fave. The pork belly was cooked to perfection and flavorful.

The waitress was attentive and nice.

Loved everything about it. We ordered the fried chicken skins and the marinated olives for appetizers, both of which were delicious. I got the Pork belly bahn mi, which was amazing-great flavor, not too much fat, but enough to make it juicy and flavorful. My son got the loco moco poutine, and the hamburger patty was a perfect medium rare. 24 taps, and a nice selection of drinks totally makes this place we will eat at frequently.

This side of town really needs a gastro pub like this. It has so much potential with a great menu, creative ingredients...however that is not enough. The bartenders on two different shifts I watched them ignore multiple customers, including myself. With their cold, dismissive personalities I never want to come back here again.

Have been here twice. Once for Happy Hour (we didn't really care for the food- chicken wings were undercooked). Staff is really nice & great beer selection. I would recommend going here for a drink but not the food. We wanted to give it a 2nd chance after trying for HH. Everything I've tasted here hasn't been good. Crab dip was ok but very oily & hot chicken sandwich lacked flavor. It was hot but tasteless. I can't say I'll go back.

Food is delicious - everything I've ever had - and they have a large beer selection and great atmosphere. 
Parking has always been plentiful when I've come and it's never been too crowded or loud in my experience. I would recommend this place for small groups or if if you just wanted a bite and a beer or two.

We've been super excited for this place to open up as we were big fans of the original Elements that was at this location. The Mr. and I decided to check it out on a Friday. We seated ourselves at the bar where we ran into some old friends. We're not beer drinkers (I know blasphemy) so I had a Powderfinger and he had an After the Gold Rush. Both were very good, but nothing that knocked my socks  next we ordered the chicken skins and the poutine with porkbelly. Both dishes were amazing! The chicken skins were the best I've had and the pork belly was perfect. The only bummer is that the Mr wanted a Sailor Jerry  and Diet Coke for a second round. The bar only carries a white and a dark, but no spiced rum. J isn't picky so he settled for just a white rum. 

All in all it seems like this will be a great neighborhood place that I look forward to visiting again. I know it's a beer focused place, but it'd be nice to see a more fleshed out cocktail menu, maybe some mead (please!), and a larger selection of alcohol in general.

Went to 595 after doing an escape room for some beers and apps. This place reminds us of a San Diego beach bar . I told The owner  Van this and he said that was his goal . We tried a few different beers from the wide array of what looks like a ever changing draft beer list . 

The service was good and attentive . 

The food was above average bar  foodie fare. We got the crispy chicken skins , the fried deviled eggs And the pretzel with beer cheese . All we're very good and would reorder . 

The ambience is part dive and part gastropub . 

Overall a great bar pub and one that we will be returning to.

I'm surprised by the other reviews bashing the service, my server was polite and available the entire time I was there. She checked on us regularly and even joked about food comas when we asked for the check. 

I went to get lunch with a friend during their happy hour. The appetizers were cheap but the portions were large for the most part. I was only disappointed by the pork tacos coming with 2 per order, it was best to get them for $5 during happy hour than double that at their usual price. I ordered the tacos and a set of nachos which I had to power through to finish. I can only wonder what the size of their entres are.

 My friend ordered wings, chili fries and the unbelievably delicious deviled eggs which she had to take home due to the large serving sizes. The eggs were breaded and baked, I've never seen that done before.

 If you want alcohol I recommend trying their beers only because the daiquiri I ordered was outrageously small- it came served in a tiny snifter glass I picked up with two fingers.

This is a true hidden gem. Beer selection is awesome and the food lives up to the hype. Pork Belly sandwiches are beyond describable, the fresh spring rolls are huge and fresh, and that chicken sandwich looks like the definition of love.

Great place for a beer.  One of the bigger selections of craft beer in town.   Tristan is a very nice and friendly bartender if you get here.  Food is good, also. My favorite is the tuna burger though you can't go wrong with the garbage fries or the pork belly burger.  I would go here more often, if it wasn't so far away from home.
Ok ok... all I gotta say is HANGOVER FRIES!!!  Everything is bomb as well. Dem fries tho! Better than animal fries from In-N-OUT. That's right I said it!!! Must check out!!

We live close by so thought we would try it out since I saw poutine. I'm Canadian so thought I'd try it but it was not as expected. I ordered the traditional poutine and signature banh mi. Gravy just wasn't for me. The banh mi was salty, not sure if it was the mayo or the daikon (those should be sweet and tangy vinegar like). Staff were great and nice atmosphere but I'd rather stick to my pho place style banh mi which would be half the price and taste better.
The service is good, but I did not enjoy my food: bahnmi with pork.   The pork was very chewy.   Hummus was very good.  Chicken wing was so so

Rotating craft beer on tap with local support and a friendly attentive staff is enough to give this place five stars. 595, however, goes above and beyond with a talented chef and diverse menu. All the favorites have just enough spin to make it taste like their own, but will not alienate the average customer. Looking forward to tasting all the offerings. I have yet to be disappointed. CHEERS!

If I can rename this restaurant, I would call it "Salt". Everything I ordered was salty, except for the water I ordered.

My order: Pork Belly burger, fries and the crafty popcorn. I don't recommend the popcorn - salty and not that great tasting. The burger was good - it helped that there was lettuce and onions in the burger to balance the salty infusion of pork belly and burger meat and sauce. The fries - salty. 

I had to drink a full glass of water after my meal to get the salty taste out of my mouth. Hubby ordered a beer so our bill was around $30.

Came here for happy hour and it was pretty well worth it. Tried a couple of things off the menu.

Tried both the original banmi slider and the chicken one. I'm not sure which was which because the server didn't tell us, but I think I liked the original one. One of our sandwiches took about 30 minutes to come out after the all the other food, so we were literally just sitting there waiting for it. When I saw slider, I thought it would come with a couple like how you usually see with sliders, but it just came with 1. I honestly think I could have skipped this.

fried chicken skins: Delicious, but I would go between "omg this is so good," and then realize I'm eating pure fat and think "omg I can't keep eating this." It's very interesting dish and they give you a lot. I would recommend it, just don't think too much about what it is because you really forget it's chicken skins. I was a big fan of the chili sauce.

fried deviled eggs: Pretty self-explanatory. I liked the sauce it came with.

The service wavered between super helpful to "I can't even get a glass of water." I literally had to try and just keep my hand up to get her attention for some water. We also had to ask for our last sandwich twice before it came.
Awesome bar, the food is delicious. My husband and I come often and enjoy it every time. The owner and staff are super cool !!
Checking this places great atmosphere nice and friendly services and the bar have a lot if options in good craft beer stop by went you have a chance

I've been here a few times and my fave dishes are: pork belly burger/bahn mi sandwich. I also love their fried chicken skins but unfortunately they recently took it out the menu. Everyone always seems nice and they have a pretty good selection of brewed beer. I only took 1 star off because for the price ($15-$17) of their main dishes, it doesn't come w/ any side of anything, not even a small portion of fries.

Pork belly burger may be the best burger in town, Unfortunately it's the only bargain on the menu. I'm shocked they don't charge 20+ based on how they price everything else.  Pricing on everything is asinine, strip prices. Over 2d per 1/3 segment of chicken wing? 7d for a tiny bowl of fries? Chicken skin has a coating that doesn't work for it 7d for small amount. Pork belly Bnah MI has the wrong bun and looks silly with so little content. 8d beers?  Sorry, this is not the strip, and while the burger was fantastic, the rest of the options are laughable.

Cool late night hang out spot! 595 Craft and Kitchen is located right behind Walgreens on Rainbow and Trop. 

They got an awesome selection of beers. I would come back just for this reason...seems their selection changes often so looking forward to their next rotation. 

Food was hit or miss....

Deviled egg: recommended appetizer which turned out to be the highlight. Fried egg white with creamy/paste-like egg yolk on top. Came with a dipping sauce. This is one of those simple but great appetizer. 

Furikake tuna burger: tuna was seared and perfectly cooked. I liked how the sauce had a hint of spice, but wish they sprinkled more furikake or offered extra furikake on the side. This was one of my favorite.

Chicken sandwich: sadly no bueno. Chicken was waaaay to greasy and there was aftertaste of old oil or grease that lingered in my mouth. 

Loco moco poutine: Choose spam, came with 3 slices. Egg was cooked perfectly with runny yolk. Fries were not too crispy as it was covered in gravy that instantly turned all the fries soggy. Gravy itself was mediocre and not my favorite. 

I'd come back here to drink. Great service but food was hit or miss. 4 out of 5 I would recommend!

Neat little place off the strip with uber chill vibes, fantastic brews and tasty, unique plates made for sharing. 

We came late on a weekend night for some nosh, not an entire meal and there was absolutely no wait. We were greeted immediately by our awesome waitress Ruda. She and Chelsea who brought us our dishes, filled waters attentively, and made recommendations were super personable and should absolutely be commended. They made our entire visit extra enjoyable. 

The table shared:
 -Fried deviled eggs with Gochujang Aioli. Beautifully plated and well received by hubs. 

-Thai Cashew Hummus with Pickled Veggies and delicious light crispy House Crackers. So different than any hummus I've tasted before! It definitely had a kick but not too much the littles couldn't enjoy it. The house made crackers were awesome! 

-Hand Cut House Fries perfectly fried and salted, served with Sambal Ketchup, Gochujang Aioli or Roasted Garlic Aioli. I hear their poutine is popular and came recommended, but plain was a veg friendly option that was certainly delish. 

All plates were very well liked and we would recommend them all. The menu has a heavy Asian influence, but you'll find anything from burgers to a handful of Bahn Mi, even a popcorn of the day. Love that last one!

Vegan and GF options available. 
Lighter options such as salads too. 

For a sweet ending the crew went for the bread pudding of the day which was a salted caramel they really loved. The Chocolate Olive Oil Budino Chocolate Soil + Sea Salt + Candied Peanut seems to be a fan favorite however. 

The craft list which is an obvious huge draw was very impressive and interesting and included many locals. It offered something for every beer drinker's taste...ambers, pilsners, IPA, blondes and pales, porters and stouts. They are heavy on the fruit here ...blueberry wheat, boysenberry sour, tangerine pale ales, a blood orange option, even pear or pineapple cider. I'm personally happy to see any pumpkin brews on a menu in the summertime! Oh, and beer aficionados, they're on tap finder if you want to see what's happening. 

If brews aren't your thing, the cocktails were creative and included the oh so trendy shrubs and bitters. They had intriguing rock and roll-ish names too. 

If you're looking to stay off the beaten path in a more casual, neighborhood bar type atmosphere and just taking a load off while enjoying brews and smaller bites, this place should be considered. 
We had a great time just chilling and snacking here.
Great food and drinks, great vibe, excellent service.  Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

595 Craft and Kitchen

Disclaimer alert...I don't drink.  I eat.

That being said, this review is about their food and service.  Overall service was good. Our server was very attentive and our items served quickly. If I had one complaint about the service, it was our server's negative comments about Yelpers. I'm not going into details to what she said.  She basically accused all Yelpers of being unethical. Bottom line, her comments put a bad taste in my mouth. What didn't put a bad taste in my mouth was their Fried Crispy Chicken Skins. This was so good, crispy, tasty, and not greasy.  If there's one food item to get at 595, this is it.  I also tried their Beer Cheese (pretzel bread w/beer cheese) and the Craft Burger.  The beer cheese lacked flavor and the burger was on the salty side.  Actually, I think everything was on the salty side.  Overall, with the exception of the fried chicken skins, everything I tried was just okay.  On the bright side, the pretzel bread and bun was fabulous.  Overall, 595 gets 3 stars from me.  Service is good, their fried chicken skin is excellent, unwarranted comments from our server sucked, and the rest of the food is just "A-Ok".

I love the vibe in this place. 

Great neighborhood bar atmosphere: Good music, friendly people, fabulous craft beers with free tastes, luscious wine list, plus a gourmet approach to comfort food. You can even bring the kids because smoking is only allowed on the patio. 

What more could a girl want?

Finally got a chance to try this new place out and all I can say is it was awesome.  Van and the staff were very welcoming.  It has nice atmosphere, reasonable prices and great service.  I got to try their Signature Banh Mi, Pork Belly burger, french fries and that Dynamite Crab Dip (Spicy!).  Everything were really good.  That pork belly burger was to die for though!  It's too bad I don't live in the area or I will be stopping by here often just for that burger.  I will definitely stop here whenever I am in Vegas.  You guys should really give them a try if you haven't yet.  You won't be disappointed.  Thanks Van!!!

GO HERE. THE BAHN MI SANDWICH WILL BLOW YOUR MIND.  

Oh yeah...btw, the beer list, atmosphere, and friendly staff will equally blow your mind!
I really like their take on Vietnamese sandwiches!  Lots of good bar food and then some!  One of my favorite lunch spots in Vegas.

I might've been a little hard-pressed to give more than 4 stars if I'd visited here only for food, but now that I'm also a fan of craft beer, this is one of my new favorite spots.

595 Craft and Kitchen is a gastropub in an area of town which isn't as well-known for that sort of thing. As I suggested above, the highlight is their craft beer selection, which is comprised of 24 rotating draft beers from local and remote breweries, more so the latter. That's great for someone like me who wants to have new tastes, and so are the $5-7 prices for most of the taps (with a few understandably pricier choices).

I won't spend (relatively) too much time on describing the beers themselves, but considering my enjoyment of each of my choices, it's a feather in 595's cap that they've procured such a selection.

I started with some beers priced awesomely for happy hour ($1 off non-local beers, from Mon-Fri 3-6pm and midnight-close), namely Mikkeller (San Diego)'s Big Hazy NE TIPA ($4 for about 10-12 oz) and the Mother Earth / Melvin collaboration Four Seasons, Spring 2018 edition (also $4 for about 10-12 oz). The Big Hazy was delicious and somewhat reminiscent of the trendy hazy IPA style, while the Four Seasons stayed more toward traditional yet fruit-tinged IPA territory.

Next, I ventured into the specials of this particular day, the $4.20 beers. I got the New Belgium Hemperor HPA first, and I'm glad to have had such a unique experience. It smells exactly like the smoke produced by one method of usage of a particular recreational/medicinal drug which has been legalized in certain states, including Nevada. The burps also have that scent. Then I went for the Lagunitas Waldos' Special Ale, which is inspired by the group credited with creating the term 420, but certainly doesn't have as much of that "dank" quality. However, I still enjoyed the rich, relatively "sweet" flavor and would gladly order it again.

Food-wise, I mostly stuck to the aforementioned happy hour deals. They'll be more than enough to satisfy my palate next time I come here, although I wouldn't mind branching out.

The banh mi slider ($3) was surprisingly true to what you might expect if you miniaturized a grilled pork Vietnamese sandwich, including all the veggies, a small baguette, a hit of something spicy, and even mayonnaise. I won't make any claims due to my inebriated status, but I would order that again.

The fries ($3) were a gigantic portion of somewhat thickly cut potatoes, and I liked them despite most pieces ending up relatively soft. They came with one helping of ketchup and two helpings of something that's like a fry/special/secret sauce, but slightly different - a higher amount of horseradish, perhaps? I enjoyed them from start to end of meal, hot to cold (room temp).

The chicken wings ($5) came out with a less-than-ideal sauce, after the bartender defaulted to buffalo style without asking me for my choice, but I still enjoyed them. Five moist pieces arrived with a mild version of buffalo sauce, proper seasoning, and a moist if not juicy interior. The ranch and celery were therefore not strictly necessary, but they were fun. These aren't battered, but you'll be able to find enough carbs elsewhere I'm sure.

I was also able to try the special of the day in the food realm, namely 2 tacos for $4.20. They were pork belly "chicharron" tacos, and both came out with properly cooked(!) tortillas, which sometimes is a challenge for restaurants for some reason. The belly was rich in flavor and had crunchy bits, and the guacamole added enough creaminess to make it not so boring. Hopefully they'll consider making this a more permanent menu item.

Atmosphere was great, although I should disclaim that having the proper amount of beer makes every place pretty tolerable. It was on the louder side, but not so much that you couldn't hold a conversation. Service was pretty solid aside from denying me the chance to try some of the fancier chicken wing sauces (but I've decided to try those in the future already, so I'm not too bummed).

I will definitely return to 595 Craft and Kitchen, especially for weekday happy hour. This is the best and most affordable combination of craft beer and great food in town so far, and although it's somewhat far from Henderson, I've been known to drive to Rainbow Blvd on a weekly basis in the past.
SALTY!!!!  Food was over salted and greasy.  The beer was not cheap nor was the food, service e the as average and the owner was kind of a jerk.  Won't be going back.
They have my fav! Blacker the Berry from a local brewer. The food is good. Definitely gourmet bar food.

We had a group of 14 and really enjoyed the food and service at 595 Craft Kitchen. The staff were friendly. The food was delicious. We had salads, chili, bahn mi, popcorn, fries, and a few other items. Would definitely go back. And the price was reasonable. It's a small venue which also made the experience intimate. The only thing was their beer menu was on the board only where as the cocktail menu was on paper. The one on the board was a little hard to see with my old eyes.

This place is awesome! I loved the atmosphere, our server was awesome, and reasonably priced! I went with my mom and my boyfriend and between my mom and I, we have a lot of food allergies. It was really cool to have a server that made sure our experience was great without a beat! I am definitely telling everyone to come here and I will be back!

Really cool tap-house west of the strip, which is really rare. I would "estimate" that they have around or over 30 beers on tap at a time and they are all top notch beers. From normal lagers to goses to different stouts and porters. If they don't have a beer that you like, then you probably don't even like beer haha. The food is also delicious! I had a bahn mi and it was very flavorful with a good kick. They also have a built in strip of metal that keeps your beer cold when you set it down on it. Check it out!

Been here a couple of times & love it. I'm all about craft beer & this place has only that. Every time they run out of a keg they switch it out with a different beer. They have all kinds of flavors & types  so there is something for everyone. I've had numerous items on their menu, the deviled eggs & the crab dip being my two favorites. I always recommend this bar when people are looking for a cool local spot to try. The owner, Van, & the night bartender, Charles, are super friendly

I went about midnight on a Friday very chilled place the owners where there very chill people from cali I believe. I had the poutine, burgers, and hummus, all really tasty Asian flavors to everything, alot of good beers and Japanese whisky. They close at 2 we were there well pass and they didn't hassle us or anything. Very cool place to check out. Oh and they have like a nitro type strip on the bar to keep your beer cold. I'm probably describing it wrong. But check this place out for sure

Came in on a Sunday night (no hh on Sunday.). They have a great selection of beers. I actually have a new fav, crafthaus! I love how they have a bunch of local brewers. The food was very good. I had the spicy chicken sandwich which had some good kick to it. I will be returning to check out the happy hour.

One of the few places that none of us had ever been to... the perfect recipe for success. At least this time it was. 

I hate deviled eggs. I like theirs. Deep fry anything I think I could at least try it... anything. I took one bite I was like this is yummy, and then I tasted the hard boiled egg, it's the texture really, but I highly recommend it to the deviled egg inclined.

Beer cheese and pretzels. It is hard to screw up a pretzel so, they nailed that. The beer cheese I had low expectations for. Just the perfect amount of beer flavor. Too many times I have had beer cheese that tastes like... just beer, not cheese at all. It was delightful.

Pork belly sandwich. I wish we would have got so much more of this. Delicious, tender belly. Tasty sauce and overall just a stellar experience without much expectation. 

THE VERDICT:
Go and get yourself some pork belly. The perfect amount of food for three people who weren't very hungry when they went, and it still tickled our stomach to the maximum. No leftovers and nothing was overly expensive. I don't know what the number 595 stands for... but you need it. Believe me. Okay... maybe not need.
Ive been in here a couple times and the food is excellent, servers are friendly, and it's nice to try new beers. The decor is very good too, just an all around good place.

Love this place! The atmosphere is great and they have great craft beer- different than any other place here in Vegas. The food was delicious and the service was good.  It made me want to come back for good beer every week!

Love this place! If you want high quality food and drinks, chill atmosphere, great service  and TVs to watch, you've come to the right place! Prices are not bad, not cheap, yet you get what you pay for. I'd rather pay more to eat well. 

I came to eat by myself on a late Sunday night, and Tristan, the server was very welcoming! I ordered a water and hot water, mentioned how I was feeling it a little in my throat, and she brought back this magical mix of hot water, honey, lemon, mint and ginger syrup. It was delicious, almost like a hotty toddy, mint mojito drink for a sore throat. She read my mind! Tristian was also helpful with helping me decide what to eat and what to expect. 

I got the house popcorn, which was furakaki that day, fried deviled eggs and house bhan mi. All was so good! It was a good portion, but since I was hungry, I finished it! Popcorn was perfectly flavored, not too strong or salty. Great to munch on. I've eaten  a lot of Bhan Mis, but this was one of the best! The baguette was warm, but not overly toasted, meat was tender and filling was flavorful. The fried deviled eggs was crispy, yet the yolk was smooth. I would definitely come back, bring friends and I highly Recommend this place! 

Pros:
Service 
Tasty High quality food and drinks 
Cool, hip, trendy, chill place 
Clean resturant and bathroom

Cons:
None

Really want to love this place......but it's just a bit to pricey. Amazing beer selection, many from local breweries. Many hard to find styles of beer. Having said that, they are all over priced just like all alcohol in Vegas. We are no where near the strip or DTLV...why should an IPA cost $7? For the sours and beer styles that cost a lot more, and more time to make I understand paying up for a beer....but this is a little much. 
While the food is innovative and has great concept, execution  is lacking or just isn't as great as we would hope. We
have been several times already because of location, and every time I feel like we spent to much money, more than we planned. I have no problem spending good money on great food and craft beer...but we are just a little let down by 595.

This may be my new favorite bar in Vegas. There aren't very many hip bars for locals off the strip so this is exactly what I've been in search of. The drinks are creative and there are a TON of local brews and other exciting beers from all over. The Asian fusion bar food was awesome and the vibe here is great. The bartenders are cool and it's a great place to come on a Monday afternoon or a Friday night. The music is low enough that talking is easy and bringing kids here during the day is totally acceptable. Yes, Yes, YES I'll be back!

Went in with a group of friends, our food didn't come out quick and we waited for almost 45 minutes! Other than the wait, everything else was pretty tasty and fresh, try their hangover fries. It's a little cozy bar/restaurant away from the strip with a great drink menu.
Wow! So much better than your typical bar and grill.  Exceptional and tasty menu of fusion foods that are also very homey.  Great music playlist.

We had a chance to check out this place when our family came to Vegas for Rise festival. I was so impressed with this place cuz its decoration and the food. Their service is supper friendly and attentive. We ordered a lot of different dishes and shared with each other. I'm Vietnamese, and I rarely eat American food. But their food is the BOMB. I think there a combination of Vietnamese style in their American food. That's why I enjoyed all dishes we ordered!!!
My favorite are chicken wings with fish sauce and banh mi belly pork. It was too damn good! I would say I was addicted to chicken wings and ordered extra one to eat at the hotel :)
Fiends, if you are in Vegas, come and check out this place. You will love it. FOR SURE!!!

We went to the restaurant today I had a pork belly sandwich my buddy had a hamburger with pork belly on it we also had chicken skins it was all of it was super awesome super yummy the service was awesome very friendly highly recommend the restaurant very good it is possible

Not really impressed with this place at all. 
Went for HH and the prices were not very "happy". Either we're the servings. 
The food was good. But not a very good bargain. Especially since the place was empty. Maybe if they worked on the HH it wouldn't be.

Stopped by this spot with some friends before we went to a concert Sunday evening hopping to hit the happy hour, but they don't do happy hour on Sundays. It's a cute little spot. I hand the deviled eggs, which the egg whites are deal fried and my boyfriend had the chicken sandwich. Both were delicious. The bartenders made our experience!! They were great and a lot of fun!

Went there for lunch. Super chill atmosphere and feels like a "Cheers" bar where everyone will know your name. Got the wings (the honey fish sauce one, can't spell the actual name haha) and they were delicious. I typically like my wings more crisp, but they hit the spot. Shared fries with the dude. HUGE serving and the sauces were great (fry sauce and garlic aioli). Dude got the brisket banh mi and he raved about it. So much potential for this little gem - thanks for opening literally a minute from where I live.

Fried deviled eggs were soooo good but service was slow. They don't have anyone to seat you and they have no sign so it's kind of confusing when you come in whether to seat yourself or not. Super new business so I have faith they'll figure out a good system soon.
small place, fast service and amazing food

Summary: Good service, dark industrial pub interior/atmosphere, good/great food depending on what you get.

Service was very friendly and attentive. I appreciated the advice on the poutines! While we ordered the bad ass chili poutine, we ended up with the beer cheese poutine. It wasn't the end of the world, since the beer cheese poutine was pretty good anyway.

I liked the industrial overhaul from what the Elements restaurant was, but I'm not a fan of the not well lit interior. I like to see my food, and my company, and it makes taking food pictures a lot more challenging (I realize that's a dumb reason :) ).

We ended up with beer cheese poutine, pork belly burger, and crispy chicken skins. Beer cheese poutine was tasty, even though it wasn't what we ordered, but it wasn't really a poutine, more like fries with cheese sauce. The crispy chicken skins were good, it wasn't greasy, but the sweet chili sauce it came with was a let down. The pork belly burger was the highlight of the meal. So. Delicious. Nothing needed to change about it.

Overall I would be back again since it's close to home and has some truly delicious options.

A cute little gastropub with a downtown LV feel in the southwest side of town, yes please. My friend told me about this place after recently finding it and loving it. We decided to go for a drink and bite to eat on a Friday around 7 pm. The place was PACKED, but luckily we were able to snag two bar seats in the corner.

The service was a little spotty. It took a while to place our drink order and get menus, but I'm assuming it's because they're new and not entirely organized. Food wise I had the Signature Banh Mi which was amazing. The flavors and spices were very well balanced and everything tasted very fresh. I also really enjoyed the cocktail I had which they said they'd be adding soon to their permanent cocktail menu. 

I'm excited to see what the future holds for this place and will certainly be back again for more.

This is a pretty cool laid back bar. Small, but tons of beer options available. Their food menu is pretty decent for a bar. They tried to mix different concepts so most of the items are very unique. The service is good and the atmosphere very fun! 

They also have happy hour from 3-6 pm and during football season they extend it until 8 pm! How cool is that!! For someone who does not smoke this is great to visit as you won't be leaving with a bad smell after hanging out here! I would totally recommend this place.

"595 Craft and Kitchen" occupies a corner spot within a suburban shopping center. You can find it easily, as you approach the intersection of Rainbow and Tropicana. I would describe this enterprise as a tap house featuring a great selection of craft beers. But what sets it apart from other tap houses are the kitchen offerings. They don't offer generic "pub food".

During my last visit, I tried the "furikake tuna burger" ($14.00). For additional $3.00, I got a small salad. I've had tuna burgers at other restaurants. That said, the taste and texture was very good; the price point, relative to the portion, was fair. As for the salad, it wasn't just chopped lettuce. It was a quality bend of mixed greens, diced tomatoes and sliced cucumber.

The complete menu, along with pricing, is available on their website.

BTW: how did I find this place? I Googled looking for a place in Las Vegas that served "poutine". Yup, they have that--and a lot of other than ordinary bar snacks.

My boyfriend and I were craving burgers and beer. We were tired from work and definitely not in the mood to go out to the strip. I remember seeing a food instagrammer post about this place so I checked it out immediately! To be honest, we both were not expecting this place to be that good since I never kept up with those food bloggers. Plus, it is a beer pub.

HOWEVER, this place had so many craft beers to choose from. Our server let us try samples until we could decide what to order. We even told her that we are a blonde ale fan and she knew immediately what to reach out for (Super chill and sweet). Each server checked up on us on a timely manner and it wasn't difficult to reach out to them even if the table/bar area is a bit segregated.

Now with the food, the fried deviled eggs were amazing. The crispiness with the soft boiled eggs were an amazing combination. The gochujang aioli wasn't super spicy and overpowering either. The pork belly banhmi had a nice jalapeno kick to it and the craft burger was extremely juicy. 

I would definitely come back again to try the other beers and menu items. The menu items definitely has a twist of American and Asian fusion, which I love!!
This place is great.  The fried deviled eggs are perfect.  They have a great beer selection.  It is small so i can imagine it gets packed, but for lunch it is fine.  Worth the 5 star review.

I came here for lunch and ordered the beef brisket Banh-Mi sandwich with fries. The food was pretty good! Good brisket, bread and pickled veggies. I feel like it was missing something that authentic Banh-Mi sandwiches have but it was good nonetheless. An Americanized gourmet version. The fries were crispy and the sauce on the side was great. I started off with 5 stars for the food. Had to dock a star for the time it took to get to our table, and another star for the high price. My meal was close to $20 (after tip) with a water.

This place is awesome! Mark the bartender took very good care of us! Amazing service and great knowledge of beer! Amazing beers! Great food! Perfect environment for just hanging out or going to get sloshy while watching football! Recommend coming here Forsure! Will be a regular from now on!

Apparently just opened 6 days ago. Excellent selection of craft beers on tap plus a full bar. The fusion food was absolutely delicious and the sauces were fantastic. The food prices are a little high for the quantity but the flavors were excellent. The fries were the best we have ever had. A bunch of dishes have extra add ons, but it worth it. The fried deviled eggs were very tasty but you only get 4 halves for $9. The spring rolls were super tasty but the wrap could have been much tighter and not so messy. The noodle salad was small but a great flavor especially if you add pork belly. The chicken wings were crispy and juicy. We had the sauce on the side since we didn't know the hoisin and sambal was going to be awesome. Though the chicken sandwich was our least favorite, it was still very good. The food seems to come one at a time and the seating is a free for all. The place is not very big and it filled up fast. Oh, don't let them take your sauces as they clear each plate. We dipped our fries in all the sauces.
Tristian our server was a delight!! She was fun and energetic. The Garbage Nachos were very good. The sambal chicken wings were hot and spicey. We'll be back.

Awesome food, cocktails and beer selection. Owners, bartenders and mangers are amazing. This place makes me feel right at home...except the food, drinks and beer are better. Finally found a place on my side of town that I absolutely love!

We ordered crab dip, pork belly banh mi, signature burger, and house fries. The crab dip, banh mi, and burger were good but I can do without the fries. Nice environment and friendly staff. Drinks were also pretty good.

We found 595 Craft and Kitchen while looking for some new exciting food and I am happy we came across it. The food here is made with many hours of work and lots of love. All that hard work and preparation shows in the layers of flavor the chef at 595 is able to produce. The combinations of flavors, service, and excellent craft beer pairings will keep me coming back for more.  In fact we came back the next day to get more great food and beers. 

I got to try the Burrata with Ginger Apricot Chutney, Gochujang Honey Chicken Wings, Traditional Poutine, Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich, and the "Butcher Block" Craft Sandwich paired with a Mother Earth Big Mother Triple IPA. We came back the following day for the Craft Popcorn, Pork Belly Burger, and Banh Mi. The "Butcher Block" burger is named as such because the meat comes from the Butcher Block just down the street and the beautiful buns are locally sourced from Great Buns. The chicken  in the Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich stays crispy even with the hot sauce on it. That Pork Belly Burger had me wanting to order another one. I'm hooked on their Banh Mi and am excited to go back and try it with pork belly. All sauces are scratch made and flavorful. Needless to say that I think the food at 595 is amazing. I could write for days about it, but you should try it for yourself.
The food is amazing here. The fried devil eggs and chicken strips are delicious. Place was busy for a Monday night. Service was a little slow and could have better. I would come here again. A+

This place is perfect! I haven't seen this kind of selection in craft beer anywhere else in Vegas! I can't wait to come here for sports games. This will definitely be my new local hang out. Keep up the good work Van!

This place is great for beer no doubt about it. Food was good but wasn't great. We ordered some chicken wings and the texture felt undercooked, they explained that is because they braised them so they are extra juicy,  my husband and I just didn't like the texture and felt undercooked. Everything else as far as food was good. I loved the music and the devil eggs.

I give 4 stars for the food. I love the craft burger. I add the egg and bacon. The crab dip is good too but this time it had chunks of meat instead of shredded crab meat. Got fried chicken skin and it was awesome. I could eat that as my meal alone. BUT both times I've been there, our order has come out wrong: missing egg or bacon or fries or the wrong dish was brought out. 
Overall, I can get over the ordering issues since they'll fix it and I really enjoy the food.

Ive been looking for new places to eat ever since I visited Vegas a couple months ago and went for a crazy one day and a half stay before I had to go back to work but of course the trusty yelp led me to this place. Besides the sweltering daily humid heat of vegas this restaurant was nice and modern. The server was great and nice and she offered me suggestions of whats good. So I ended up getting the pork belly burger and accompanied it with a Belgian sour cherry beer for the drink. The pickled slaw they had on the pork belly and the sauce went pretty well with each other and the fries were crispy. I loved the Belgian sour cherry beer I got and everything from start to finish was great. This place definitely didn't disappoint and it was like a tall glass of shade in this desert heat. Being checked upon if everything was great led to some great service even though their were only a couple people there but mostly at the bar. Itll be one of my go to's when I visit vegas again so I can have a pork belly burger again and try another beer as well. Thanks guys

Bartender was talking and walking around looking bored but we still had to flag him down every time we needed something. Didn't check on us once.  If he was busy I would have understood. Really small bar for 2 bartenders to run and still give shitty service. Only reason I gave 2 stars was because the USB shirt guy was awesome and came out at the end and actually provided customer service. Thanks USB shirt guy!

This is the kind of place Las Vegas needs! Phenomenal food, awesome beer selection, attention to detail, and welcoming. I'm a liquor executive and I know food and beverage on a professional & personal level. This is a gem! Good job Van-Alan & Chris! 
Your loyal customer! Damien with 1855 Distributors.

Hey now, I have nothing bad to say about this place! 

Clean, local, service on point and their food choices weren't the usual bar food you'd expect. 

Deviled eggs, chicken skins and Pork Belly Banh Mi? Excuse me, what? 
Also, their daily popcorn? Yes please. Poutine too? Duh. 

I love the aura of a local bar. Everyone was there just to hang out and relax, maybe watch a game. Talk to each other and see what they're eating. lol. So chill. 

The last time I was there, we couldn't stop ordering the deviled eggs! Please try those! And it was the first time I tried the Pork Belly Bahn Mi. Tender and melts in your mouth and punches with flavor! 

They also have a ton of interesting desserts. Don't miss out! Oh and all the beers and cocktails. ;) So...GO GO GO. :D

Pork belly bahn mi and hot fried chicken sandwich. That's all you need to know. Well, also they have awesome craft beer, fast friendly service and you can catch Knights games there without being completely packed like sardines.

Finally a gastropub located in spring valley that is worth visiting. Came here on a nice Sunday afternoon and was greeted by the bar tender/waiter. he told us that happy hour is all day Sunday and the menu had a lot of dishes. We had the following
Chicken skin 5/5
Deviled eggs 4/5 cause it was fried 
Crab dip 5/5
And there fries that I swear from In and out 5/5 love it!!!
I would come back and re-rate cause the ambience ,service,quality of food and price is top notch.

The food was delicious. 

Walk in and seat yourself. They will come around with a menu. 

They are starting a brunch menu! Woot woot! 

The breakfast burrito was SUPER DELICIOUS. Eggs, fries, pork belly, .... holy smokes.... so good. 

The Beef brisket Bahn Mi was on point as well. The meat was tender and it dry. The bread was toasted nicely and the marinated daikon was excellent. 

The service was good. 

Overall I would definitely recommend and come back.
Service was great! Food was great, vibe was great! Only note is some more seafood options! Fish and chips or shrimp something! Def will come back! And they play good music!!
Truly unique experience in Las Vegas! Van the owner is awesome and the staff gives great service. Great selection of craft beers and food is top notch!

It's hard to believe a restaurant with a menu this tasty is in a strip mall behind a Walgreen's and a gas station.

Remarkable food. I'll come here again and again.

Place was awesome! 
Food was awesome!
Atmosphere was awesome!
A little small, didn't get to sit in a booth because of a large group, but overall, the high tops were fine. 
4 stars only because I wanted more on the menu!
I wish they made a furikake burger, wasn't feeling a tuna one. But the burgers were great. 
Drinks too!
Our server was awesome too!

Came tonight for my second time in less than a week. The food is ridiculous. I want to try everything. First time in I had the loco moco fries, those were amazing. The gravy had such had flavor to it that I had to force myself to stop eating it. Tonight's meal was no different. I had the pork belly banh mi and it was the best banh mi I've ever had! The drink selection is good too. I had a craft cocktail each time I've been in and also tried the grapefruit sour they have, so far nothing has been a disappointment. I like the small bar feel and the staff was very delightful. They have been very attentive and friendly both times I've been in. I'm looking forward to going back soon and trying the fried deviled eggs!

I tried 595 Craft Kitchen twice and didn't enjoy either time.

First, it is definitely NOT family friendly for dinner.  The music and noise is super loud and it's more of a pub type atmosphere.

I had their signature burger.  Supposedly they get everything fresh daily.  The patty was dry and boring.  The buns, while "artisan" were overwhelming.  I felt like I was eating bread with a tad bit of beef i inside.  Fries were normal.  

Not sure if I'll be back for a third try.

My boyfriend and I love craft beer and were so excited to try this new place with such a focus on bringing in the best beers from the surrounding areas. We went last night for the first time and the selection didn't disappoint. Normally we like 1-3 beers on the menu, but Craft Kitchen had at least 10 that we loved. The servers were so knowledgeable and friendly, they brought us over samples of beers they thought we'd like without us even requesting to try them. I also loved the asian fusion in the menu and that their support of the local community is reflected in both the food (using Great Buns bread) and beer menu. We will definitely be back!

I've been dying to come try this place! It's on the corner of trop and rainbow. The interior is very gastropub and it's so beautiful. 

The prices were mouth dropping, affordable pricing but such quality with the food. I had the burger, tuna burger, and poutine. When I lived in Canada all I did was sample poutine and 595's is very very authentic tasting. They just need to add more cheese curds and they'll be solid! The burger and tuna was cooked to upmost perfection. Weird that I paid 2$ for ONE slice of bacon on my burger though.

Drinks ordered Mother Earth beer, powderfinger and after the gold rush. The after the gold rush drink was disgusting and the server was so so nice to me and offered his own drink called the Trinidad sour. THANK YOU ERIC! He was literally psychic because I didn't complain about my drink and he knew i didn't like it. Eric gave me the best service I've ever received at a bar/restaurant. He kept my water filled and kept checking on me to make sure everything was delicious. My mother earth was perfect. Great service, drinks, and food! I will be back :)


Btw it's confusing bc I didn't know if it was open seating and none of the servers had a uniform on

Today is my first day here. My starts will be one for all. The bartender took my orders but could not understand what he was saying and not freindly. He even over charged me by 13 dollars by mistake or what..??

 The hamburger patty is way under cooked and all fries sojoo 0 soggy,wings have no taste at all and burnt. Soooooo terrible for what i had to pay for

Will Never go back.
Very great place they have great cocktails, and the chickens skins was super crispy and delicious. I like that place
The food is surprisingly delicious.  Burgers are juicy and the chicken skins are a must try!!  Drinks are also very good!!
Awesome ! A cool place with nice servers. We all had burgers and loved our food. I put an egg on my mind which was delicious. I'll be back. Maybe to watch a Golden Knights Game ! Thanks

We are happy this place has opened so close to home! Casual atmosphere with really good food! We are wine people but enjoy trying new things and our server really helped us select the right beer to go with our meal. My husband had the burger and was very happy, I had the signature bahn mi and it was delicious! We shared the buttermilk cheesecake and that knocked our socks off! We will be back!

This place has plenty of choices when it comes to beers. Additionally, they are definitely helpful when helping you choose a beer. My wife chose an IPA and she hates the hoppy beers. It was an awesome choice too. 

The food is typical bar fare, cranked up to eleven. I had the pork belly banh mi and I thought it tasted delicious. The beer cheese was meh, but its hard to make that amazing in my opinion. Coming back if I am in the neighborhood.

Heard about this place like 15 times and finally made it over.  Damn! Not sure what I waited for.  This place is great.  Very good service, huge beer selection and a great food assortment.  

The wings, burgers and beers are great

The food was alright, but not worth the price they're charging. It was $13 for just a burger that was less than 4 inches in diameter and they charge extra for fries! Looked more like a child's burger. It was very crowded and loud inside. They had the music a little too loud so everyone was yelling to talk. The water they brought out had a taste to it like they're using dirty lines even though they recently opened. I won't be going back.

This place has good and tasty food!  This is a gastropub atmosphere and so it is loud inside. They do need a larger beer selection though.  Every dish we tried was very flavorful and I did not have any complaints about the food. It was weird that we didn't have any plates to use and all had to eat out of the trays that the food was served on. The food here is meant to share I would recommend it as well so you can try all the different dishes.

The service on the other hand needs improvements it as always hard to get the waitresses.

Modern small little gastropub, pretty friendly service - we just sat wherever we liked. They have a good selection of beers, a little pricy but ok. I read some yelp reviews that claimed the food was a bit salty and I would have to agree. We got the crispy fried deviled eggs which were very crisp, unfortunately they were fairly standard and came with a sauce that wasn't really necessary in my opinion. The hot fried chicken sandwich was pretty hot for me but had great flavor - just would have loved some pickled vegetables on the side or some sort of slaw to cool everything down. The loco moco poutine was good with spam but it was way too salty. Gravy flavor was excellent though. 
I will admit we could have ordered a little better and had a more balanced meal - that being said the loco moco all by itself with spam was very salty. 
Overall not bad. 3.75/5.

Three weeks ago my husband and I decided to take 595 for a spin since we live right down the street. We absolutely fell in love with this place it was the best ever!!! The beer, the food, the vibe was awesome!!!! The week after we took our in laws they loved it and have talked about going back constantly even though they live in Henderson. This place is awesome!! Great food and great drinks.

Unfortunately I can't give 5 stars due to a few days ago me and my husband brought our friends to have them try since they all live around the area as well. When we first got there it was completely full and we looked at the bartenders he said it's open seating sit anywhere we sat at the first table available that was for 8 people. We made sure we only used half of the table Incase other people showed up ( we know these places always have to share seats so not a big deal. However at the end of the night after buying drinks, apps, entrees, and more drinks and spending over 100$. We go to the restroom and as I am walking back to the table one of the waitress who didn't even help us rudely says " are you already done we have people waiting you know". We immediately get up pack up and leave my husband didn't get to even finish his beer he just ordered. I understand we were in the wrong here we should have tried to stand or go to the bar since we were only 4 at an 8 table but I have to say I was very disappointed in the way we were talked too. Even if she had said maybe you guys can sit in the bank benches. Other than that horrible everything else is awesome! The food and beer are amazing!

Went here for some food and to watch the Golden Knights game. They have a bar area and some tables where you seat yourself. They have a wide selection of beers on tap with a menu full of fusion type bar foods. They have TVs playing sports on every side so you don't miss the games. 

We tried the fried deviled eggs (appetizer menu) and traditional poutine (fries menu). Both were excellent and I'd recommend trying them out. They also had board games available to play at your table.

Came here twice already in 2 weeks. Great new spot on the Westside! 

I'm not a beer drinker but they have a lot of craft beer. The Cocktails are really well crafted also. 

Love the Vietnamese influence in the cuisine. Everything was well balanced, flavorful & delicious. 

This place is very casual and not pretentious at all. I guess you can say it's a little bit hipster. 

I'll definitely come back again with friends!

This place was made for drinking, or for immediately after you regret drinking. 
Smothered fries, every single kind they offer, are going to be deceptively filling. 
Really the big reason I keep ordering from them is their deep fried deviled eggs. I'm just gonna leave that there and let you discover for yourself why.

This place doesn't disappoint at all. Try Deviled Eggs is a must, ask for the Banh Mi toasted, heirloom tomatoes are bomb.com, try the Briney Melon beer. The staff member are nice and let's not forget about all the great beers. Really wish they had flights though. It'll really kick it up a notch if they did.
Excellent customer service and the food is really good, the choice and beers are awesome as well definitely recommend giving his place a shot

Trust the great reviews, they are true.  Great selection of craft beer. Pork tacos and fried devilled eggs are amazing, especially at $5 each from the happy hour menu!  Fantastic, friendly service.  Even had a final call for happy hour!

Parking, no smoke, great music.

Highly recommended.

Yum! I took some coworkers here as we were all out of town visiting. YESSSS to the Bahn Mi!!! They have quite the selection here and I would DEFINITELY return. We got the traditional, brisket and pork belly- all 3 delicious. Also enjoyed the beer selection.

This gastropub has a lot of Asian-inspired dishes. They also use a lot of salt which is not Asian-inspired. If you want Instagrammable food porn, go when the sun is still out. Otherwise, it's daaark in this place which is perfect if your dating confidence is not high. The lack of lighting and the good drinks (per friends who drink) are your friends.

I've tried several dishes here...

Fried Deviled Eggs: 
Just what it is plus, a gochujang aioli dipping sauce. I think it's the dipping sauce that makes this salty. Eat without the dip and it's just fine. 3.5/5

Crispy Chicken Skins:
Lightly breaded chicken skins, deep-fried. Comes with a sweet chili dipping sauce. Possibly the best appetizer on their menu. Savory and crispy. 4/5

Beer Cheese:
Pretzels you dip into beer cheese. I didn't like this. I don't even know how to describe it other than add beer to Cheez Wiz and dip bread into it. 2/5

Banh Mi:
Pretty good but nothing spectacular. Comparable to banh mi you can get from Chinatown. 3/5

Pork Belly Burger:
I was under the impression I'd get like a pork belly sandwich. What I got instead was a thick beef patty topped with pork belly! Yum! But what was missing was the acidity to cut off the fattiness and richness of the beef and pork belly. Texture-wise, they could've added more crunch to this burger with some fresh crisp veggies. 3/5

Fries:
Really crunchy fried potatoes. Well-seasoned. I think they fry them twice to get the perfect crunch. Ask for regular ketchup if you don't want their salty dipping sauces. 4/5

Dynamite Crab Dip:
Chunks of imitation crab in sriracha aioli with a side of different types of bread/ cracker. I think they could've shredded the imitation crab a bit so when you scoop up some dip, you get a nice even ratio of crab and aioli instead of a big chunk of crab coated in aioli. 2/5

Vermicelli Noodle Salad:
Not sure why this is called a salad as there was not enough greens/ vegetables for it to count as a salad. You can add proteins to it like grilled garlic chicken, pork belly, etc for a few bucks more. The dressing is watery, vinegary and has a nice spicy kick to it - it goes well with the dish. 3/5

Furikake Tuna Burger: 
Ground tuna patty - yeah, I don't like the thought of that. I'd have to skip writing about this.

Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich:
Crispy fried chicken.

Chocolate Budino:
Bittersweet chocolate that's smooth and creamy. 

As you can tell, I just got lazy towards the end of this review. This place isn't as exciting as the other reviews make it seem. There's usually just 1 or 2 servers/ bartenders working so, if more than 3 tables are occupied, the service can be slow/ lacking. Also, it seems like every time we come here, there's always people making out or necking. LOL.

This is a hidden gem. They have such a great combination of delicious Asian inspired food, and a great beer selection. We brought a table of seven and ended up passing around all of our meals because they were all so tasty! The staff is very knowledgeable and the food service was quick. All the food I would order again. The pork belly is the best thing there, no matter what you order it on, such as a sandwich or burger. It is basically the highest quality bar food that I've had in any recent memory.  We ended up spending around 130$ for 7 people
Great burgers, great beers, great poutine, great bahn mi- how often can you say that?! This place has a relaxed, comfortable vibe plus an awesome playlist.

I have mixed feelings of this place so I'll list them basically through pros and cons.

Pros:
The warm buratta cheese dip is AMAZING! It comes with crispy pita and chips (a variety with some being salty and some being bland).
The staff is friendly and easy going.
Great selection of beers especially since they have some sour ales (a favorite of mine!)

Cons:
The table was messy like sticky messy. Whoever is cleaning kind of need to be aware of that.
The seating area was small so if you have a party of more than 4 be aware because you may need to grab two tables.
Burgers were just mediocre which is negative because if in paying 10-15$ for a burger I expect it to be different than whataburger. Not bad but nothing special.
Fries are 7$??.... that seems kinda high to me but that's my opinion.

Overall dinner cost 60$ for two people getting burgers ... too pricy in my opinion. I'd check it out simply because of the beer selection though!

Been going there for a couple months, brought tons of friends to this new establishment.  Knowing its a new restaurant, it's going to have it's moments.   Great beer selection and great bartenders/staff.  Menu looks promising for the most part.

One day, I went there by myself after work and I had an order of chicken wings that didn't agree with me.  I noticed it was bloody inside, sent it back to the kitchen and they voided it.  Mind you, I work in a restaurant on the strip and using a thermometer prior to sending out an order of chicken wings will save you the headache.  I had chicken wings here before and when it's not busy without no issues. Things happen when your busy with happy hour and it being a newer restaurant.  Please don't justify your not wrong by telling the server/bartender to tell you the temperature it came out after my wings were served bloody inside.  If you have a oven and a warmer, please pre bake your wings in the oven, hold it in a warmer, and then fry the wings to order will solve that issue. Logistic and temperature issues solved especially when your busy during happy hour.

I really like this place, but after this incident I think I'll eat at home to be safe.

Drove past this place a month ago and couldn't wait for it to open. It's a small bar with big personality. They have a cool craft cocktail program, and interesting beer list. As a bit of a beer geek I am really excited to have a local place with a interesting beer list. The staff was cool, Laid back, and attentive. We really didn't have to ask for anything. I will be going back ........... often!!
Great atmosphere, fantastic food, solid beer selection and friendly staff! You always find better places to eat outside the strip.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

This is becoming me and my boyfriend's go-to bar. Super chill vibes with a pretty good beer selection. Nice selection of rotating drafts, including local beers. TVs everywhere, of course, with a clear view in every seat.

The food is not amazing, but I really enjoy the Asian/Vietnamese fusion. I tried their Furikake Tuna Burger, Craft Burger (added bacon and egg), and Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich. The tuna burger was just okay, but I really liked the Craft Burger. During happy hour, I like getting the Bahn Mi slider and my boyfriend LOVES the Chicken Skins, which I personally don't like, as it basically tastes like all fried breading and barely any actual chicken skin. 

On nice days out, they slide the windows up so you can feel some breeze, adding some more *chill* to the bar. They also have wifi, games (like Cards Against Humanity, Cranium playing cards), and coloring books!
Poutine fries are to die for ugh I drool every time I think about it. Foods amazing, and drinks are made with love.

Do you like beer ? Do you like craft beer? Do you like it ice cold? Well 595 has all three with out a doubt. 24 taps of Stouts, ales, IPA's, Sours, constantly changing line up of kegs so always something new to sink your taste buds into. Now for the really "cool" part. The bar counter top has an ice cold steel rail built into it that you set your beer glass on top of to keep you drink ice cold.(I've included pictures) I've only seen this at one other bar before (in Salt Lake City) I can't believe more places haven't incorporated this awesome experience enhancing addition. 
 The bar and table area is not too big so it can fill up fast. We were in on a Saturday evening and it started out real quiet but a few hours in and the place was bustling. People laughing, drinking, eating and having a good time. The decor is pub style, clean and comfortable. Two unisex bathrooms that are well kept also.  
 The food menu is just the right size and will satisfy the hardiest of beer munchies. Items range from finger foods, salads, Springs rolls, nachos to unique sandwich and burger choices. Tonight we snacked on the Thai hummus appetizer (flavor explosion )while sipping on bar tender recommended IPA's. 
 The whole staff seemed to take on any duty necessary to keep everyone eating, drinking and having a good time. I especially enjoy that there is no video poker and that they're not just another run of the mill, cookie cutter, average, smoke filled Vegas strip mall bar. 
 Unique, fun and satisfying. Get down and get join the party for yourself. What are you waiting for!!!?????

I came with some friends and we ordered: Thai Cashew Hummus, Crispy Chicken Skins, Beer Brined Chicken Wings in Gochuhang and Buffalo, Beef Brisket Banh Mi, and Beer Cheese Poutine. Oh and the special of the day which was Fried Salmon.

The Thai Cashew Hummus was REALLY good. A little spicy and different than anything I've had before. They give you quite a lot. I would definitely go back just for this hummus.

Beer Cheese Poutine is definitely an appetizer to share. So good though!

Crispy Chicken Skins were a nice snack, but the batter was a little to heavy for my liking. A little less and it would have been perfect.

I do not recommend getting the wings if you're expecting Gochujang flavor because it definitely was NOT that. They were ok, a little too dry. The buffalo wasn't anything special. I asked for a side of Hoison sambal sauce because I was curious what it tasted like. NOT like Hoison at all. it was too vinegary and I did not like it.

Beef Brisket Banh Mi was also a tad dry. Pouring some of the chili sauce from the Chicken Skin helped make it much better. So I'd recommend asking for some on the side if that's the case for you.

Surprisingly we didn't try any of the beers. I'd definitely come back for some of the food we liked and to try some beers.

Strong drinks and bitchin' food!!!!!!!!!!!! The cashew hummus and buffalo wings was the varsity first stringers. Second string on food was the spring rolls and the tequila lime popcorn. Just wowza. Love the cool and random diversified menu. Very awesome little gastropub. We loved our cocktails and would definitely be back.

ALTHOUGH! My friends did not like their crab dip and burrata/ginger chutney dips. They said the crab dip resembled a kind of Japanese-lasagna type dish with tortilla chips? And the burrata and chutney dip was like just warm burrata in a wok with no chutney. But our food was so good otherwise we didn't care.

Gr8 for Vegans!

It's Sunday and a beautiful day to have an ice cold beer. We did our typical Yelp and saw this great find. We've seen it before, but this time we took the plunge. Great beers, wonderful and delicious food. We took advantage of their everyday Happy Hour except Saturday and all day when there's a game on Sunday. We enjoyed the fried chicken skins, wings and basically ordered one of everything on the HH menu. Their regular menu had a great selection, folks next to us ordered the Furikake Tuna Burger and said it was excellent. Tristan our lovely bartender, who we affectionally call Jimmy Joe, because my 90 yr old Father in law Bob, who we then called Bobby Joe was hitting on her...lol, she was very friendly and a great sport! It's a great place, lots of fun... a must go to place!

Absolutely love this place. It's a nice little hidden gem. It's a Small to medium sized restaurant with a fusion of Vietnamese / American bar food?  All I know is it's delicious. Make sure to try one of their Banh Mi sandwiches and fries. They're to die for. Can't say I'm a huge craft beer guy but what I had was good. The service is decent and pretty fast.

Who needs a side of fries when you have fried chicken skins!  The chicken skins probably didn't help my cholesterol...but I couldn't stop eating them.  A very large portion, each bite perfectly crispy and seasoned (salty with a slight kick).  The batter is light and crunchy and paired with a sweet chili sauce.  This was definitely a great side to my furikake tuna burger.  The tuna burger was quite possibly just slightly under seasoned for my taste but seared perfectly.  To clarify, one review scared me when they mentioned ground tuna....the tuna was a seared tuna steak cut into slices...no ground tuna here.  I thought the garlic aioli, arugula, heirloom tomatoes, and shitake mushrooms were a perfect pairing for the tuna.  
I might see if they can turn this into a salad for me next time, the bun was a little underwhelming.  The chicken skins were so good, I wanted to shove them inside my tuna burger....  My husband got the loco moco poutine, opting for the hamburger patty.  I sampled a fry with the gravy and the gravy was on point.  I saw they have a brunch menu on the weekends with some good options.  We will definitely be back.  I kept talking about the chicken skins all weekend....please get them!  It's a bar but we also saw some kids eating here, they have a separate dining section.  Limited table seating, mostly bar tables...so might not be the best with lots of little kids.  We did note they have at least one high chair.  The one down side, don't come here if your looking for a "quick" bite.  The food took quite some time to come out of the kitchen, and we were there on a slow night.

Loved this place!  The Thai cashew hummus was out of this world!  Delicious!! Crispy chicken skin was tasty too.  Nice beer selection. Service was great. Friendly staff. We will definitely come back to try some of the other choices on the menu.  Laid back atmosphere.

First thing First, the food is beyond amazing. I came in for the fried deviled eggs and everything else kept me in. My girlfriend is veryyyyy picky with her wings, and she loved them from here. We even placed another order. I'm a big sauce person and all the sauces here are amazing. The only part that wasn't the greatest was the service. There was only one lady working and many people were there so I understand why she was overwhelmed, just wish they had more staff! I will definitely be back, hopefully tommorow

My boyfriend and I first came across this place when we were getting tired of eating the usual food that we always get. Scrolling through Yelp, we saw this place and the food looked completely appetizing. The pictures do not disappoint, they look exactly like they are portrayed. This is a cool place to bring a bunch of friends if you just want to kick back, relax, and roast each other.

I wish I could give 3.5 stars....

595 was highly anticipated and much needed in the area. The menu is great and the food is delicious. This is a fantastic place to enjoy craft beers and they are very supportive of local breweries. They also regularly host the local beer community for bottle shares and special events.
