The reason they don't get 4 stars or more from me (yet) is because of the service. The 1st time I was in there was for a bottle share, which had been planned pretty far in advance. The server who was scheduled to work that day had apparently called in (which is no fault of the restaurants, that stuff happens). In a pinch, they had the wife (I think) of the Manager fill in. It didn't go so well, unfortunately. She wasn't familiar with the beers and we ended up with not 1, but 2 issues with our bill. She charged us for someone elses tab.

Anyhow, it wasn't a major deal breaker - I would still consider them a new place with some kinks to work out, but overall it's a great vibe and we need more places like this in town. Definitely check it out if you get a chance.

So far I'm here because 1. I realized my first review was very shallow and I can't understand why as usually I go into detail in regards to review. 

Also, I had take out last time which I failed to mention. 

So I thought to myself , well that is not cool. I decided to come in again by myself so I could really soak up the experience. 

One of the first question I ask the lady at the bar in regards to the Poutine was "How is it prepared ?" 

She hit me back with a side look and said "what do you mean?" And just stared at me a bit. 

She then said "fries , Gravy a fried egg scallions. " 

...... so far I'm displeased just by her asinine attitude. 

The crowd at the present are mostly middle aged or late 40's. 

So while I appreciate that you went into great detail being the public representative of your company I'd more so appreciate a person who isn't obviously miserable to be here at her job. 

I deal with many people through out the day and she isn't as welcoming or informative as me id like, however I'll not dote on. 

She asked me what type of wings did I want I said I didn't know she told me the selection. She said what she liked best so I decided to pick those. 

So now I await my poutine and these wings made with a Korean marinade with Hoysen and gochujang. 


I'm Korean so I'm taking her suggestion. I'm also understanding so I'm not going to assume this will be the attitude for the remainder of my meal. 

I do dish off a heavy attitude myself when disrespect is concerned. 

I'll brb.

Ok as far as the wings and using Korean ingredients. I'd honestly love for them to have more flavor. Korean food is well known for being super flavorful. 

They weren't horrible they just didn't hit that high peak of Asian expectations I have when using my homeland ingredients. 

I'd love to come in and show you the best way to prepare these to be honest. 

Also the poutine was much better. The fries were freshly made. The gravy is way too thick in my opinion. The curds were perfectly melted as opposed to my ice cold curds I had prior. 

Overall the atmosphere was super chill. Everyone was enjoying the Golden Knights game , the bar maid's attitude didn't bug me as much as she seemingly is there only for the drinkers and I was sitting at the bar. 

The quality of the food is good and I only had a few things. I took some hummus to go and even though we are super Asian we just could not get past all the sweet notes and how you pair it with cracker or pita bread. 

I think some veggies with that sort of hummus would be spot on. It wasn't as velvety as I like my hummus, which does tell you they make it in-house yet they could work on the texture a bit.

Loved the food, service, and how clean the place is! I tried the beef brisket sandwich can I say delicious. The beef was so tender and juicy. I will definitely come back to try other things on their menu!

Went in here after it opened and was excited for a new bar in the area. We had frequent d meraki grill next door and was long anticipating its opening. We went in around 1130 on a Saturday and sat at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and offered great service. We enjoyed their beer selection and immediately ordered one for the lady and I.  We ordered the brisket banh mi and a burger for the lady with fries. The brisket was $11 with an extra $3 for a side salad. The burger was around the same. The burger came out and was good but small and overpowered by the lettuce on top. The brisket sandwich lacked any brisket. A $11 brisket sandwich should have more than one layer of brisket. It also didn't complement the bread (which was good). The bread was large and at least three times the height of the brisket which further made the lack of brisket even more significant. The sandwich had good flavors but ultimately would have been happier eating at subway.  Hopefully they're able to add some more meat to that sad sad brisket sandwich.  Tldr: beers great food lacks value.

We ordered  salad it was a hearty serving of fresh and crisp veggies, beer cheese, and garbage nachos. We also enjoyed the Atomic Duck IPA and  a diet coke. Then stuffed to the brim we couldn't say no to dessert, a delicious bread pudding. Service was impeccable ,too bad we aren't local, I would definitely come back! Good brew, good food, and good service. Highly recommend !

The vibe of this place is pretty cool.   I love the huge list of craft beers written on the wall.   There is a huge selection to choose from which can be daunting but also exciting to get something you've never had before. 

The food was pretty average in terms of bar food.  I really liked that they try to make it funky and fun but I think the execution is off.   For example, the fried chicken skin and the crab dip were so salty that even my beer couldn't tame the salt but the cabbage salad was seriously lacking in flavor.   That item was close to being my favorite if it only had some seasoning or pizzazz.   

I was surprised at the portion size of everything.  They were very large for the pricing in my opinion. 

The service was ok too.   You seat yourself which is fun but it also means you wait a hot second for the server especially if it's busy.   Also I think there might have only been one server plus the bartender so we did have to wait for drink refills and the check.   However, I will say that our server was awesome when we did see her.

Went to
Went to check out this place with a buddy. We tried a couple of the specialty drinks, an appetizer and a couple of entrees. The Chartreuse Mule and Mezcal Cup were a bit much. You probably have to have a very particular taste to enjoy them. Overall, the food and drinks were pretty good. I'd recommend trying them out for something a bit different than typical bar food.
Great food, beer and service! This place is definitely one of my favorite places to go after a long day at work. I highly recommend this place. Try the chicken skins!

So my husband and I decided to check this place out last night for a quick bite to eat before going to a show. If my rating could only reflect the service, i would give it 5 stars. We sat at the bar and were greeted immediately. Shortly after, we ordered our drinks and food, and were impressed  at how quickly  everything  arrived despite  how extremely busy the restaurant was. Prior to arriving we looked at the reviews  and pictures  on yelp. And I have to say that the presentation  was just as perfect as the photos. But here's the problem ....... this is where our satisfaction ended . 

Although everything  we ordered was prepared perfectly,  2 out of the 3 dishes were lacking flavor.  We had the chicken sandwich,  crab dip,  and bad ass fries. The chili on the fries was extremely  bland. The chicken sandwich was a decent size, and it was so moist  it could melt in your mouth, but it lacked seasoning. The crab dip however, was phenomenal. 

Due to the great prices, wonderful service, and quality of food, i would still give it another shot. The chef could have just had a bad night. Overall, a good experience.

Food is amazing and beer is good. Highly recommend the "loco mock" poutine, craft popcorn and the BNS beer (blood orange revolver IPA). The bartenders are incredibly friendly as well! Wonderful place!
Cool small local hangout good craft beers & food is very good. Bartenders were nice & attentive will be back soon.

Stopped by this place before heading into the strip because my friend was raving about it! And boy, it did not disappoint. I had the Pork Belly burger and it was by far the most amazing burger I've ever had. It was so moist and juicy and the flavors were on point. The customer service was great as well. The beers on tap were really good too! When you order drinks at the bar, the bartop has a built in apparatus (not sure what it's called ) to keep your drinks nice and cold. Genius! Perfect for the sweltering heat in Vegas. This will definitely be my watering hole every time I go to Vegas!
Stopped by on a hot day for a burger and a drink. Everything was good. Service was very friendly and if you enjoy old school rock this is a place for you.
Vacation with friends & family. New, bright staff, relaxed vibe.  Beer list is extensive, food was delish. We'll be back in October... so many choices... so many beers

Here's the lowdown ~~

Place is super cute, and I love the aesthetic.

Service is super friendly and I loved that our server was very attentive, but I would've appreciated a little more space and time to ponder the menu and enjoy our meal. Otherwise, she gave some great recommendations and was knowledgeable about the menu.

I really enjoyed the fried deviled eggs. Super original and delicious idea. I was super skeptical, but it wasn't greasy at all. Plus, the breading was very well done.

I was not a fan of the heirloom tomato salad. I thought the food quality was good, but I wasn't a fan of the dressing. Something about it reminded me of barbecue sauce, but my boyfriend loved it, so I think it's just up to preference. 

My boyfriend loved the signature banh mi. He thought the pork was amazing and said it was the best Viet sandwich he ever had.

Overall, even though I was kind of disappointed in my salad, their menu looks super promising. I'll definitely be back for drinks and the food (especially that broccolini banh mi).

This was definitely my first time coming here, maybe partially because they're still fairly new.  The location isn't too far for me and the best part there is plenty of parking. I was a little bummed because I couldn't partake in drinking, they have a pretty good selection of crafted beers and cocktails. I will definitely be coming back for some sangria.  
After observing the menu and getting feed back on the food, I decided I definitely wanted to try the Deep fried devil eggs and Vermicelli Noodle salad, they said the dressing would be worth it. Boy was he right Themis salad was so good, the dressing amplified the greens and I am a sucker for noodles.  I would definitely recommend the salad and the Deviled eggs was a good starter, it had a unique flavor and the textures was good, I even try dipping it In my dressing and it was soooooo good. 
Another recommendation was the bread pudding of the day- so of course I had to jump in dessert, the current flavor was Reese Peanut Butter cup, and boy was it good, I loved the cream and sauce m, it was a perfect balance and it was moist and not soggy, so the texture and flavor was in point. I just wish I could finish it, but sadly it's meant to share.
Overall, I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. The staff super friendly and very knowledgeable, they will definitely give you some good recommendations. The quality of food is delicious and good, they definitely take pride on providing fresh and high quality ingredients.

5/5 quality of food 
5/5 atmosphere (TVs and bars!!) 
5/5 customer service
They have the BEST chicken skins! Prices aren't that bad, not cheap but worth every penny! I came in with a bunch of my coworkers one night and considering it was my first time the server took his time with us and recommended some of his favorites. They have good drinks and bars on the happy hour menu as well! 
We caught them on a busier night so the food took forever to come out, but everything else was great. Will definitely revisit :)

Came here on a Sunday evening.  

I had the noodle salad topped with egg and seared pork belly.  My friend and I also shared the popcorn of-the-day: kochujang and honey.  

The popcorn was a little overly "wet" or mushy which I guess was to be expected when mixing it with honey and spicy bean paste.  But we did not get a choice on what kind of popcorn we wanted.  After about halfway in, it became too salty for our palate.  I understand the need to be unique and the blending of flavors, but to me it did not work.

The "noodle salad" was reminiscent of the Vietnamese "bun" dishes at any pho restaurant.  I thought the chef might have been going for some type of fusion--so naturally I expected more melding of differing flavors East and West.  I saw none of that.  It really looked like an imitation of a pricier and less authentic bun dish.  The noodles used were a bit stiffer and slightly chewier than the vermicelli used in pho restaurants.  Despite the menu's description, it didn't taste any better.   It also got saltier towards the bottom of the bowl.  In a pho restaurant you can add as much of the sweet/savory nam pla as you want, but here it's added when prepped.  It's also more saltier than your traditional nam pla fish sauce.  

The pork belly was cooked fairly well--tender and semi-moist.  

They had 1 waitress and 1 or 2 bartenders.  Service got slow when the relatively small dining area filled up to about 50-75% capacity.  We were checked up on once after the main course was dropped.   I didn't use the bathrooms, but my friend said they were very clean and immaculate.  

No dessert offered and I can't remember if anything was on the menu.  But we went to the Fluff Ice down the road on Russell and Rainbow.

Ate here with a group and had the deviled eggs, pretzels and cheese, wings and crab dip. Everything was AMAZING! I had the chicken sandwich for dinner and it was perfectly cooked with the perfect amount of spice. To top things off I had the blue eden which was easily the best drink of the day. Highly recommend going here if you're looking for a place off the strip!

Came in here around midnight for a quick night cap after dinner with my girlfriend. Place was fairly empty but the bartender Charles was friendly and attentive. His knowledge of beer was extensive and offered plenty of tasters to help us choose the perfect pint. Awesome bartender, he came off really genuine and we had a good conversation for about an hour. Ended up with a triple IPA and an imperial stout from Stone, which were delicious. Great hospitality here, great tap list and cool bartenders are what keep me coming back here!

Wow!!!  We ordered 4 different dishes to try out but we really wanted to order the whole menu. We had the fries putton, vermicelli noodles, chicken sandwich and the pork belly bahnmi. Everything was delicious but let me tell you about the chicken sandwich. Just plain AMAZING!!  everything about it was just perfect; it was crispy to the last bite. But it was a light fluffy batter. Not greasy by so much flavor. It wasn't just a pieces of over cooked chicken breast. It was perfection!  Best damn chicken sandwich I've had & what I've  been craving. 

We will def be back to eat more of that and try the rest of the menu.
We just moved to Vegas and needed a quick meal. 595 was great! We ordered burgers, the poutine fries, and pretzel. It was delicious. They had a great selection on beers and great service.

595 Craft and Kitchen has quickly won a place in my heart. Serving up an intriguingly tasty variety of dishes, they have everything from banh mi to deep fried deviled eggs. I haven't had a single dish that wasn't exceptional and made with love. The burgers are juicy and flavorful, their chicken sandwiches are spicy and fried to perfection and even their popcorn is enhanced with beautifully creative flavors. 

What makes this place even better is their ever rotating selections of beer. Focusing on craft beers from all over they carry some of my local favorites as well as breweries from out of state that are exceptional. 

Service is always on point as well. Friendly staff, delicious food and a lovely beer selection has easily made this one of my favorite new spots!

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile and finally popped in for a drink with a group. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very chatty and fun. I had the rum based cocktail I can't remember the name but it was very strong and so good! Not so strong it tastes like pure liquor but not sweet either. Delish. I then had fried chicken skins and shared the fried deviled eggs they were so yummy. I think this will be a fun to hang out to come to and they have a good deal on happy hour

Came here on a first date. Great environment to chat and get to know someone. Food was delicious and perfect portion sizes to share. Had a good beer that I wouldn't have normally tried. I'll definitely return for more fries with different toppings. :-) hopefully on a second date!

Came here tonight for dinner. Saw on yelp it is a recently opened business and wanted to try something new. Inside the ambience is casual and the first thing you see when you walk in is a bar area go the right and then seating area to the left. 

It's self seating and the bar was full so we chose to sit in a small table for four. It took a little while to get our drink order. I ordered an apricot cider which was a bit sour but good. My glass had some lipstick stain on it and I was not wearing any lipstick so I had to send it back unfortunately. The waitress was very apologetic and was happy to get me a new glass. 

The food was good. We got fried chicken skins and dynamite crab dip for appetizers. The crab dip was pretty good and had a kick to it. The chicken skins were good and reminded me of calamari but everyone on yelp raved about it so far so we had to give it a try. 

I ordered the signature banh mi. It was okay. Not the banh mi I'm used to but the bread was soft which I liked. My husband got a pork belly burger and he ate that all up. 

Overall, we had a good experience and will most likely come back to try other things on their menu.the random Buffalo head adds a nice touch to the place since it's the only decoration they have on the wall.
